list.title: Question 1
list.content: Which of the following provides evidence for a higher level of biodiversity now compared to any time in the past?A.\hspace{1em}Changing levels of atmospheric carbon dioxideB.\hspace{1em}The fossil recordC.\hspace{1em}A decrease in the rate of evolutionD.\hspace{1em}Decreased levels of speciation
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The number of organisms found via the fossil record for any era is much lower compared to the number of organisms found on Earth now and those that continue to be found, soChoice Bis correct.Choice Ais incorrect as changing levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide provide evidence for humans' impact on carbon dioxide levels.Choices CandDare incorrect as evidence suggests that the rate of evolution and speciation are increasing, which provides evidence for increasing biodiversity.

list.title: Question 2
list.content: What is adisadvantageto an organism of being multicellular rather than unicellular?A.\hspace{1em}Larger body sizeB.\hspace{1em}Ability to adapt to their surroundingsC.\hspace{1em}The need for a complex exchange systemD.\hspace{1em}Cell differentiation
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Multicellular organisms are comprised of numerous specialised cells, enabling them to achieve larger sizes compared to unicellular organisms. This results in them needing exchange systems, such as the circulatory and respiratory systems, to manage waste removal and to acquire essential substances such as oxygen and nutrients. In contrast, unicellular organisms can rely on simple diffusion.Choice Cis correct.Choice Ais incorrect because although multicellular organisms often have a larger body size than unicellular organisms, this can be advantageous to them.Choice Bis incorrect, as multicellular organisms adapting to their environment more easily is an advantage.Choice Dis incorrect, as cell differentiation, where cells become specialised for specific functions, is an advantage as it allows for the division of labour amongst cells.

list.title: Question 3
list.content: The organisms in the table below all share a common ancestor.OrganismVertebraeTwo pairs of limbsSweat GlandsTroutPresentAbsentAbsentBlack bearPresentPresentAbsentHumanPresentPresentPresentUse the data in the table to draw a cladogram.[2]State the source of variation which allowed organisms in the cladogram to diverge into different species[1]In cladistics, state the name used to describe a group of organisms which have all evolved from a common ancestor.[1]
list.markScheme:
Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​a node for a common ancestor[1]→\ce{ -> }​organisms in the correct order (trout, black bear, human)[1][2 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/44ad43f9-26fa-4810-80af-e45631739993/images/a702b776-b79e-4f55-8a6c-2b7ca3b3f99f/273ai.png)

Onlynames of organisms expected, features added just for explanation.→\ce{ -> }​mutations[1][1 mark maximum]→\ce{ -> }​clade[1][1 mark maximum]

list.title: Question 4
list.content: Which statement about eukaryotic cells is correct?A.\hspace{1em}Eukaryotic chromosomes are circular and the DNA is associated with histone proteinsB.\hspace{1em}Eukaryotic cells have looped DNA molecules which are not associated with proteins in the nucleusC.\hspace{1em}Eukaryotic cells have linear DNA molecules associated with proteinsD.\hspace{1em}Eukaryotic cells have linear DNA molecules that are not associated with histone proteins
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The chromosomes of eukaryotes are linear, and the DNA is coiled around histone proteins (Choice C).Choice Ais incorrect because eukaryotic DNA molecules are not circular.Choice Bis incorrect because eukaryotic cells do not have looped DNA in the nucleus.Choice Dis incorrect because the linear DNA molecules in eukaryotic cells are coiled around histone proteins.

list.title: Question 5
list.content: Which statement isnottrue about the genome?A.\hspace{1em}The human genome is organised into chromosomes.B.\hspace{1em}Each liver cell contains a full copy of the genome.C.\hspace{1em}Organisms of the same species share most of their genome.D.\hspace{1em}All the information carried by the genome is expressed in each cell.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Not all genes are expressed in each cell. Only the necessary genes are expressed based on the specialised function of the cell.Choice Disnota true statement, and so is the correct answer.The genome is all the genetic information of an organism, including the genes and non-coding DNA. In humans, the genome is organised into linear chromosomes in the nucleus, and circular chromosomes in the mitochondria.Choice Ais a true statement and so an incorrect answer. Organisms of the same species have most of their genome in common; however, variations give rise to some diversity between individuals.Choice Cis a true statement and so an incorrect answer. Each cell in a multicellular organism typically contains a full copy of the genome, including liver cells, an exception is red blood cells as they do not have a nucleus.Choice Bis a true statement and so an incorrect answer.

list.title: Question 6
list.content: Which isnota cause of the current biodiversity crisis?A.\hspace{1em}Decreased urbanisationB.\hspace{1em}The widespread use of vaccinesC.\hspace{1em}Increased air travelD.\hspace{1em}Increased transmission of diseases
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Urbanisation is not decreasing, it is increasing all over the world, which is contributing to the current biodiversity crisis.Choice Ais correct.The widespread use of vaccines has led to fewer people dying of diseases before reproductive age, contributing to worldwide population growth, which contributes to the current biodiversity crisis, soChoice Bis incorrect. Increased air travel results in more pollution and makes it easier for diseases to spread worldwide which sometimes negatively impacts species, contributing to the biodiversity crisis, soChoices CandDare incorrect.

list.title: Question 7
list.content: Which of the following statements is the correct definition of evolution?A.\hspace{1em}Heritable characteristics of a species change over time.B.\hspace{1em}Organisms are reproductively isolated.C.\hspace{1em}Learned behaviours change over time.D.\hspace{1em}Organisms are bred for desired characteristics.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Evolution is the change in the characteristics of a population over time; these characteristics can be passed from one generation to another (Choice A).Choice Bis incorrect as it describes when organisms are reproductively isolated, which is a mechanism that may lead to evolution in a population.Choice Cis incorrect because it refers to learned behaviours which are learned within an organism’s lifetime and are not genetically inherited.Choice Dis incorrect as it refers to selective breeding.

list.title: Question 8
list.content:
The scientific name for the little spotted kiwi isApteryx owenii. Which of the species below is most closely related to the little spotted kiwi?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/9878cab2-bbf6-4ef3-affc-520f8a700b10/images/6faa3925-6492-47de-90a7-925e1e8a2859/BI1227.png)

[Source: Adapted from Lapsley Miller, J. (2023, August 28).Little Spotted Kiwi. Wikipedia. Retrieved September 13, 2023, from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_spotted_kiwi.  Copyright under CC BY-SA 4.0]A.\hspace{1em}Apteryx australisB.\hspace{1em}Little spotted pardaloteC.\hspace{1em}Owenii apteryxD.\hspace{1em}Neognathae owenii
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Species names are given using the binomial system, where the genus comes first, and the species follows. Species with the same genus have similar traits and are closely related;Choice Ais correct.Choice Bis incorrect as it is not a scientific name, so conveys no information about the relatedness of species.Choice Cis incorrect as it is just a reversal of the scientific name of the little spotted kiwi, and is in a different genus.Choice Dis incorrect as it is not in the same genus as the little spotted kiwi.

list.title: Question 9
list.content: Which statement(s) are possible solutions to the biodiversity crisis?I.Promoting rewilding projectsII.Recycling and reusing productsIII.Increase meat consumptionA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Rewilding projects attempt to restore and rehabilitate ecosystems by reintroducing native species and allowing natural processes to become re-established.Statement Iis therefore correct. Recycling and reusing products means fewer resources will be extracted from the Earth which is a process that can destroy natural habitats and lead to excessive landfill use, soStatement IIis correct.Choice Cis therefore correct (Statement I and II).Increasing meat consumption (Statement III) results in more land being cleared for animals such as cattle to be bred, decreasing biodiversity.Choice Dis therefore incorrect as it includes this statement.Choices AandBare missing one of the possible solutions to the crisis and are therefore incorrect.

list.title: Question 10
list.content: Which of the following is a reason why water is retained on Earth and does not escape into space?A.\hspace{1em}Different patterns of rainfall across continentsB.\hspace{1em}The gravitational pull of the MoonC.\hspace{1em}Surface temperatures high enough to allow evaporationD.\hspace{1em}Earth’s gravitational field
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Earth's gravitational field exerts a force strong enough to retain gases and liquids, including water vapour, in the atmosphere and hydrosphere. Without gravity, water molecules would have sufficient energy to escape into space. Gravity is the key reason why Earth can retain an atmosphere and surface water.Choice Dis, therefore, correct.Choice Ais incorrect,  as although rainfall is a part of the water cycle and is responsible for distributing water,  it does not directly contribute to the retention of water on Earth.Choice Bis incorrect,  as the moon's gravitational pull regulates tidal movements in Earth's oceans but does not directly contribute to water retention on Earth.Choice Cis incorrect as water is lost from bodies of water on the surface of the Earth and evaporates into the atmosphere, which doesn't directly address water retention.

list.title: Question 11
list.content: What intermolecular bond is responsible for water's cohesive, adhesive and thermal properties?A.\hspace{1em}Covalent bondB.\hspace{1em}Hydrogen bondC.\hspace{1em}Ionic bondD.\hspace{1em}Metallic bond
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:In water, a hydrogen bond (Choice B) is formed between partially the positively charged hydrogens of one water molecule and the partially negatively charged oxygens on another water molecule.Choice Ais incorrect because this bond is intramolecular.Choices CandDare incorrect because water does not form ionic or metallic bonds with itself.

list.title: Question 12
list.content: What is the best definition for a species?A.\hspace{1em}A group of individuals living in a defined area.B.\hspace{1em}A group of individuals of the same species living and interacting with one another in a given area.C.\hspace{1em}A group of individuals living in a given area and interacting within the environment.D.\hspace{1em}A group of individuals that can interbreed and produce fertile offspring.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A group of individuals living in a defined area is not a biological definition (Choice A).  A group of individuals of the same species living in a given area at the same time who are interacting with each other is a population (Choice B) and the environment in which they live is a habitat (Choice C). It is only when they can interbreed to produce fertile offspring that they can be considered a species. (Choice D).

list.title: Question 13
list.content: What evidence can be, and has been used, to determine the members of the same clade?I.\hspace{1em}Base sequence of genesII.\hspace{.7em}Amino acid sequence of proteinsIII.\hspace{.4em}Physical appearance of organismsA.\hspace{1em}II onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and IIC.\hspace{1em}II and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme:
DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice D is correct.
The DNA sequence (Statement I) and amino acid sequence (Statement II) are the usual, present way of determining members of the same clade, however, physical appearance (Statement III) was previously, but is now rarely, used.

list.title: Question 14
list.content:
The diagram below shows the structure based on the tetranucleotide hypothesis proposed by Levene that DNA was made up of equal amounts of adenine, guanine, cytosine and thymine. This hypothesis was a problem of induction, because it was based on a limited set of data. Subsequent evidence and data revealed a more complex and accurate understanding of the structure, leading to the falsification of the initial hypothesis.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/c484d68d-401b-4ccb-a303-8569362604cf/images/424b8f94-9954-4d95-81cb-be101c01ad19/BI0895A.png)

[Source: JWSchmidt (2006).Tetranucleotide. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved July 6th, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Tetranucleotide.png. CC-BY-SA-3.0-migrated-with-disclaimers]Which scientist is credited with falsifying the tetranucleotide hypothesis?A.\hspace{1em}Erwin ChargaffB.\hspace{1em}Rosalind FranklinC.\hspace{1em}Alfred HersheyD.\hspace{1em}James Watson
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because Chargaff used paper chromatography to show that the proportions of adenine (A) and thymine (T) are the same, as are the proportions of guanine (G) and cytosine (C). There are not equal proportions of A, T, G and C.Franklin (Choice B) and Watson (Choice D) are credited for their contributions to the overall structure of DNA structure. Hershey (Choice C), along with Chase, is famous for his research which provided evidence for the idea that DNA, rather than protein, carries the genetic code.

list.title: Question 15
list.content: What property of water helps living organisms maintain their internal body temperature?A.\hspace{1em}Thermal propertiesB.\hspace{1em}Cohesive propertiesC.\hspace{1em}Adhesive propertiesD.\hspace{1em}Solvent properties
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Water's thermal properties (Choice A) include a high heat of vaporisation which results in the absorption of a large amount of heat by water before changing its physical state. This means that changing the temperature of the water is slow, and this helps to maintain the internal temperature of organisms between set limits.Water has cohesive properties (Choice B) which means it sticks to other water molecules.Water has adhesive properties (Choice C) which means it adheres to charged surfaces.Water is an excellent solvent (Choice D) which means it dissolves a wide array of polar and ionic substances.

list.title: Question 16
list.content: What is the most accepted theory for the origin of water on Earth?A.\hspace{1em}Asteroids from space containing ice arrived on Earth billions of years agoB.\hspace{1em}Respiration from early organisms released water into the atmosphereC.\hspace{1em}Heat from ancient deep-sea vents catalysed the reaction between hydrogen and oxygen atomsD.\hspace{1em}Early volcanic eruptions, released steam into the atmosphere
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Asteroids from space, which contained ice, arrived on Earth. This is the most accepted theory for the origin of water on Earth. This theory, often referred to as the "Late Heavy Bombardment" theory, suggests that during the early stages of the Solar System's formation, a significant number of asteroids and comets, some of which contained water in the form of ice, bombarded the Earth. Over time, as these icy bodies collided with Earth, they contributed to the accumulation of water on the planet's surface.Choice Ais correct.Choice Bis incorrect, as water was present on Earth before early organisms were present.Choice Cis incorrect because free oxygen atoms were absent in the early atmosphere.Choice Dis incorrect because liquid water would need to be present on Earth before it could be converted into steam.

list.title: Question 17
list.content:
What type of cell is shown in the image?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/cb7991c0-6eee-4fa1-81bc-74345942fcf6/images/be97c032-ac41-4e78-8ebb-0e74c97826e6/BI0392ii.png)

[Source: Adapted from Itayba, Hebrew Wikipedia. (2016, March 1).Category: Electron Microscope Images. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Electron_microscopy.jpg  Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}A eukaryotic cell because it contains mitochondriaB.\hspace{1em}A prokaryotic cell because it has a plasma membraneC.\hspace{1em}A eukaryotic cell because it does not have a nucleusD.\hspace{1em}A prokaryotic cell because it contains ribosomes
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Eukaryotic cells contain mitochondria but prokaryotic cells do not.Choice Ais correct.Choices BandDare incorrect as the cell is not prokaryotic; it has a nucleus.Choice Cis incorrect because the cell has a nucleus.

list.title: Question 18
list.content: Which statement(s) about the endosymbiotic theory is/are true?I.\hspace{1em}It provides evidence for the origin of prokaryotes.II.\hspace{.7em}It provides evidence for the origin of eukaryotes.III.\hspace{.5em}It provides evidence for spontaneous generation.A.\hspace{1em}II onlyB.\hspace{1em}I onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The endosymbiotic theory states that larger prokaryotes engulfed smaller prokaryotes, which were the ancestors of modern chloroplasts and mitochondria, eventually evolving into eukaryotes.Choice Ais correct.Statement I (Choices BandD) is incorrect as prokaryotes were not formed by the endosymbiotic theory. Statement III (Choice C) is incorrect as spontaneous generation is impossible.

list.title: Question 19
list.content: Which of the following is not soluble in water?A.\hspace{1em}GlucoseB.\hspace{1em}Amino AcidsC.\hspace{1em}CholesterolD.\hspace{1em}Sodium Chloride
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Cholesterol (Choice C) is a non-polar hydrophobic molecule. Therefore, it is insoluble in water.Glucose (Choice A), amino acids (Choice B), and sodium chloride (Choice D) are soluble in water and are hydrophilic.

list.title: Question 20
list.content: What substances are attracted to water and form intermolecular bonds with water molecules?A.\hspace{1em}Insoluble substancesB.\hspace{1em}Hydrophobic substancesC.\hspace{1em}Hydrophilic substancesD.\hspace{1em}Non-polar substances
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Hydrophilic (Choice C) substances dissolve in water through the formation of hydrogen bonds with water.Non-polar (Choice D) substances are not attracted to water molecules and do not form bonds with them. These substances are hydrophobic (Choice B), making them insoluble (Choice A) in water.

list.title: Question 21
list.content:
Which is the correctly annotated diagram of a molecule of water?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/edd73f4a-ca99-4c0a-8aa6-5dd7c70ee984/images/a5ccea10-4644-40e3-934c-b5de3575771e/BI1011iii.png)
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A water molecule consists of 2 hydrogens and one oxygen connected by single covalent bonds. Water molecules are polar, with a slight negative charge on the oxygen (δ-) and a slight positive charge on the hydrogens (δ+) due to unequal sharing of electrons.Choice Bis correct.Choice Ais incorrect as it consists of one hydrogen bonded to two oxygens.Choice Cis incorrect, as water molecules are not linear due to the sharing of electrons.Choice Dis incorrect as oxygen is not slightly positive (δ+) and hydrogen is not slightly negative (δ-).

list.title: Question 22
list.content: Which structure in a eukaryotic cell would also be present in a prokaryotic cell?A.\hspace{1em}NucleusB.\hspace{1em}Plasma membraneC.\hspace{1em}80S ribosomesD.\hspace{1em}Histones
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells contain a plasma membrane;Choice Bis correct.Choices A, CandDare incorrect as they are present in eukaryotic cells but not prokaryotic cells.

list.title: Question 23
list.content: In cladistics, which is the correct definition of a clade?A.\hspace{1em}A group of organisms with the same DNA sequenceB.\hspace{1em}A group of organisms that share a common ancestorC.\hspace{1em}A group of organisms with different DNA sequencesD.\hspace{1em}A group of organisms that do not share a common ancestor
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis the correct definition for a clade, a group of organisms that share a common ancestor.Choice AandCare incorrect as they do not feature the idea of a common ancestor.Choice Dis incorrect because organisms within a clade do share a common ancestor.

list.title: Question 24
list.content: Which row in the table correctly identifies structures which are present (✓) or absent (✕)  in prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?StructureProkaryotic cellsEukaryotic cellsA.\hspace{1em}70S Ribosomes in Cytosol✓✕B.\hspace{1em}Cell Wall✕✓C.\hspace{1em}Mitochondria✓✕D.\hspace{1em}Naked DNA✕✓
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotic cells contain 70S ribosomes in their cytoplasm, while eukaryotic cells have 80s cytoplasmic ribosomes, soChoice Ais correct.Choice Bis incorrect as prokaryotes have a cell wall, but not all eukaryotes do.Choice Cis incorrect as prokaryotes do not contain membrane-bound organelles such as mitochondria, but eukaryotes do. *Choice Dis incorrect, as prokaryotic cells have naked DNA, whereas eukaryotic cells contain DNA within a nuclear membrane.

list.title: Question 25
list.content: According to natural classification, organisms in the same group had what in common?A.\hspace{1em}MorphologyB.\hspace{1em}Anatomical characteristicC.\hspace{1em}Modes of nutritionD.\hspace{1em}Common ancestry
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because organisms placed in the same group share common ancestry.Choice AandChoice Bare incorrect because morphology and anatomical characteristics are used to describe the structures of organisms which are used to primarily group them together.Choice Cis incorrect because modes of nutrition are used to describe organisms but not to classify organisms.

list.title: Question 26
list.content: What provides evidence that all life on Earth evolved from the same population of cells?A.\hspace{1em}Eukaryotic cells evolved from prokaryotic cells.B.\hspace{1em}Both mitochondria and prokaryotes have a cell wall.C.\hspace{1em}Both eukaryotes and bacteria contain histones.D.\hspace{1em}The genetic code is universal.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:All 64 codons of the genetic code are present in all organisms, apart from minor variations indicating that all life evolved from the same original cells  (Choice D).Eukaryotic cells evolved from prokaryotic cells (Choice A) is incorrect as this is the endosymbiotic theory.Choice Bis incorrect as mitochondria do not have a cell wall.Choice Cis incorrect as bacteria do not have histones.

list.title: Question 27
list.content:
These photographs show the same section of a human retina. What is the reason for the difference between the two diagrams?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/34eb27e0-6237-4360-ac56-27073683e781/images/58faa56f-a89c-49e0-824a-bfbe19119bb9/BI0391_1.2.png)

[Source: Nestl, A. (2012, January 17).FileAMD Super resolution Cremer.png - Wikimedia Commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 16, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Opthalmology_AMD_Super_Resolution_Cremer.png Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}The photograph on the right was taken using an electron microscope.B.\hspace{1em}The photograph on the right is at a higher resolution.C.\hspace{1em}The photograph on the right is at a higher magnification.D.\hspace{1em}The photograph on the right shows the ultrastructure of the cells.
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The resolution is the ability to distinguish between two objects.Choice Bis correct.Choices AandDare incorrect because a photograph taken using an electron microscope would allow the ultrastructure of the cells (fine detail of cells, such as organelles) to be observed.Choice Cis incorrect because these photographs are magnified at the same power.

list.title: Question 28
list.content: Which of the following correctly describes the images produced by electron microscopes?I.High resolutionII.High magnificationIII.ColouredA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Electron micrographs have high resolution (Statement I) and high magnification (Statement II)Choice Bis therefore correct.Electron micrographs are not coloured (Statement III).Choice Ais incorrect as it only includes one correct statement.Choices CandDare incorrect because they includeStatement III.

list.title: Question 29
list.content: Parameciumproduces enzymes that catalyse different chemical reactions taking place in the cytoplasm. What function of life is demonstrated in this situation?A.\hspace{1em}ExcretionB.\hspace{1em}HomeostasisC.\hspace{1em}ReproductionD.\hspace{1em}Metabolism
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice A- Excretion is the removal of metabolic wastes from the organism. Paramecia expel waste products such as carbon dioxide through the process of diffusion.Choice B- Homeostasis pertains to the ability of living things to maintain a stable internal environment. Paramecia maintain a stable internal condition by expelling excess water using the contractile vacuole.Choice C-   Reproduction is the biological process by which organisms produce offspring that are biologically similar to themselves. Paramecia can reproduce sexually through meiosis and asexually through mitosis.Choice D- Metabolism refers to all the chemical reactions in organisms such as anabolic and catabolic reactions. Paramecia produce enzymes that catalyse different catabolic and anabolic reactions in the cell.

list.title: Question 30
list.content: Which organelle has a double membrane?A.\hspace{1em}Rough endoplasmic reticulumB.\hspace{1em}Golgi apparatusC.\hspace{1em}NucleusD.\hspace{1em}Vacuole
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The nucleus is the only organelle among the options listed that has a double membrane. The nuclear envelope consists of two lipid bilayers: the inner membrane and the outer membrane.Choice Cis correct.Choices A,BandDare incorrect as they all have a single membrane.

list.title: Question 31
list.content: Which row in the table correctly identifies structures which are present (✓\checkmark✓) or absent (×\times×)  in prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?StructureProkaryotic cellsEukaryotic cells\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}80S ribosomes✓\checkmark✓×\times×\hspace{1em}B.\hspace{1em}Plasma membrane×\times×✓\checkmark✓\hspace{1em}C.\hspace{1em}Nucleus✓\checkmark✓×\times×\hspace{1em}D.\hspace{1em}Mitochondria×\times×✓\checkmark✓
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotic cells do not contain mitochondria but eukaryotic cells do.Choice Dis correct.Choice Ais incorrect as eukaryotes (as well asArchae) contain 80S ribosomes.Choice Bis incorrect as both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells contain a plasma membrane.Choice Cis incorrect as eukaryotic cells contain a nucleus but prokaryotic cells do not.

list.title: Question 32
list.content: Identify the correct row in the table regarding the formation of vesicles when lipids are mixed with water.Structure of vesicleFeature of fatty acid tailMembrane formationA.\hspace{1em}monolayerhydrophilicspontaneousB.\hspace{1em}bilayerhydrophobicspontaneousC.\hspace{1em}monolayerhydrophilicinducedD.\hspace{1em}bilayerhydrophobicinduced
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:When lipids are mixed with water, they spontaneously form bilayers because the hydrophobic tails of the lipids interact with each other, and the hydrophilic heads interact with the water. This leads to the formation of a lipid bilayer, which is the structure of a vesicle. This is a spontaneous process driven by the amphipathic nature of the lipid molecules. Therefore,Choice Bis correct.The membrane around the vesicle is not a monolayer of phospholipids (Choices AandC) because the hydrophilic phosphate heads of the outer layer naturally point outwards into the surrounding aqueous solution, while the heads of the inner layer point inwards to the aqueous contents. The fatty acid tails are hydrophobic, not hydrophilic (Choices AandC), and they align in the centre of the bilayer to minimise exposure to water.Additionally, vesicles are not induced to form in this context (Choices CandD) since the amphipathic nature of phospholipids leads to their self-assembly into bilayers, making external input or induction unnecessary.

list.title: Question 33
list.content: Which structure found in a eukaryote has a double membrane?A.\hspace{1em}Golgi apparatusB.\hspace{1em}MitochondrionC.\hspace{1em}LysosomeD.\hspace{1em}Endoplasmic reticulum
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Organelles of a eukaryotic cell are enclosed by a single or double membrane. Double membrane-bound organelles include the nucleus, mitochondria, and chloroplasts. So, a mitochondrion has a double membrane.The Golgi apparatus (Choice A), lysosome (Choice C), and endoplasmic reticulum (Choice D) all have a single membrane.

list.title: Question 34
list.content:
The photomicrograph showsChlorella, the cells of which contain chlorophyll.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a549579f-5d03-4a34-99a1-cdcb73fb3959/images/f787f899-db4e-48d7-9c4c-fc7fb4e26e99/image.png)

Magnification: 100 x\hspace{3em}Scale bar = 10 µm[Source: Adapted from User: NEON. (2014).Chlorella vulgaris Beijerinck Nies-2170 / Olympus IX71+DP72.Wikimedia Common. Retrieved April 6, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Chlorella_vulgaris_NIES2170.jpg. Copyright by CC BY-SA 3.0]Which statement best explains how chlorophyll supports a function of life?A.\hspace{1em}It catalyses the breakdown of glucose into ATP.B.\hspace{1em}It absorbs light energy needed to convert inorganic molecules into organic molecules.C.\hspace{1em}It transports carbon dioxide into the chloroplast for glucose synthesis.D.\hspace{1em}It stores the energy released during cellular respiration.
list.markScheme:
BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Baccurately describes chlorophyll’s role in photosynthesis, a process that supports the life function of nutrition in autotrophic organisms (like plants and some unicellular organisms). Chlorophyll absorbs light energy, which is used to convert inorganic carbon dioxide and water into the organic compound glucose.Choice Ais incorrect because this describes cellular respiration, not the function of chlorophyll.
The breakdown of glucose into ATP happens in the mitochondria and does not use chlorophyll.Choice Cis incorrect because chlorophyll does not transport carbon dioxide; CO₂ enters the leaf via stomata and diffuses into chloroplasts. Chlorophyll’s role is to absorb light, not transport gases.Choice Dis incorrect because chlorophyll is involved in capturing light energy, not in storing energy from respiration. Energy from respiration is stored in ATP, not in chlorophyll.

list.title: Question 35
list.content: Which of the following statements is true of fungal cell walls?A.\hspace{1em}They are composed of cellulose.B.\hspace{1em}Fungal cells do not have cell walls.C.\hspace{1em}They are composed of chitin.D.\hspace{1em}They are composed of peptidoglycan.
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because fungal cell walls are primarily composed of chitin.Choice Ais incorrect because cellulose is the main carbohydrate that makes up plant cell walls. Peptidoglycan is found in bacterial cell walls, soChoice Dis incorrect. Fungal cells do have cell walls, soChoice Bis incorrect.

list.title: Question 36
list.content: Which of the following statements are true about the structure of cells?I.All cells contain cytoplasm enclosed by the plasma membrane.II.The microscope was important in understanding the structure of the cell.III.Prokaryotes do not have genetic material.A.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyB.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis true because all cells have cytoplasm enclosed by the plasma membrane.Statement IIis also true because the invention of the microscope made viewing structures within the cell easier.Statement IIIis false because all cells have genetic material. Eukaryotic cells have their genetic material inside of the nucleus, while prokaryotes have their genetic material in the nucleoid region.

list.title: Question 37
list.content: A strand of nucleotides reads CCUAGAGCUUACCG. Which type of pentose sugar could be found in the nucleotides in the natural composition of this strand?A.\hspace{1em}Deoxyribose onlyB.\hspace{1em}Ribose onlyC.\hspace{1em}Both deoxyribose and riboseD.\hspace{1em}Neither deoxyribose nor ribose
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The nucleotide strand CCUAGAGCUUACCG contains the bases cytosine (C), uracil (U), adenine (A), and guanine (G). While C, A, and G are found in both DNA and RNA, the base uracil is only found in RNA. So, the strand is an RNA strand.RNA contains the pentose sugar ribose. Therefore, ribose is found in the nucleotides in the strand.Choices AandCare incorrect because deoxyribose is only found in DNA, not RNA. The nucleotide strand cannot be DNA because it contains uracil in place of thymine (T).Choice Dis incorrect because the strand is RNA which contains ribose.

list.title: Question 38
list.content: Outline how hydrogen bonds form between water molecules.[2]State one of the ways that hydrophilic substances interact with water.[1]State one of the ways that non-polar molecules interact with water.[1]Distinguish between cohesion and adhesion.[2]
list.markScheme: Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​hydrogen bonds are formed between the hydrogen atom of one water molecule and the oxygen atom of another water molecule[1]→\ce{ -> }​hydrogen atoms in water molecules are partially positive[1]→\ce{ -> }​oxygen atoms in water molecules are partially negative[1]→\ce{ -> }​hydrogen bonds are a polar attraction and electrons are not shared[1][2 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:In water molecules, hydrogen bonds are formed between thepartially positive(✓\checkmark✓) hydrogens of one water molecule and thepartially negative(✓\checkmark✓) oxygens of other water molecules.Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​they are attracted to and form intermolecular bonds with water[1]→\ce{ -> }​they form hydrogen bonds[1]→\ce{ -> }​they dissolve in waterORare soluble in water[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Hydrophilic substances areattracted to water(✓\checkmark✓)  and form intermolecular bonds. They are said to besoluble(✓\checkmark✓) in water.Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​do not freely associate with water[1]→\ce{ -> }​hydrophobic are repelled by water[1]→\ce{ -> }​do not dissolve in water OR insoluble in water[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Non-polar molecules arehydrophobic(✓\checkmark✓) anddo not dissolve(✓\checkmark✓)  in water.Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​in cohesion, water molecules stick to each otherWHILEin adhesion, water molecules adhere to the polar,ORcharged, surfaces of other molecules[1]→\ce{ -> }​cohesion explains water’s surface tension propertiesWHILEadhesion explains capillary action[1]→\ce{ -> }​in plants, adhesion allows water to travel by capillary forcesWHILEcohesion is responsible for maintaining an uninterrupted water column[1][2 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Water molecules are polar, with one end being partially positive and the other end being partially negative. This polarity allows water to form hydrogen bonds with other molecules. Whenhydrogen bonds form between two water molecules, this is cohesion(✓\checkmark✓), whereas hydrogen bonds forming between water and other polar molecules isadhesion. An example of adhesion and cohesion working together would be in plants, where water travels up xylem vessels against gravity. This is possible becausecohesion maintains an uninterrupted water column(✓\checkmark✓), and the adhesion of water to the cellulose walls of xylem vessels drives the water upwards throughcapillary action(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 39
list.content:
The micrograph below shows the longitudinal cross-section of a stem from a plant in thePinusgenus.  Xylem vessels are clearly visible.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ce64231b-0a07-4418-a59e-8dfdae6072ce/images/a56a5858-4bcb-449c-b27e-2d6d5a622fdd/BI1046.png)

Magnification: 100X[Source: From Berkshire Community College Bioscience Image Library. (2014).Radial section: Pinus stem magnification: 100x iron-alum hematoxylin and safranin stain. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved April 29, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Gymnosperm_Stem_Soft_Wood_in_Pinus_(36087426450).jpg.
Copyright by CC BY CC0 1.0
]The xylem is composed of hollow, tube-like tissues that transport water through capillary action. What property of water explains capillary action?A.\hspace{1em}Melting pointB.\hspace{1em}Adhesive propertiesC.\hspace{1em}Specific heat capacityD.\hspace{1em}Buoyant forces
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Adhesive properties (Choice B) refer to water’s ability to stick to charged surfaces or polar molecules. This, together with cohesion, allows water to move against gravity up the stem through capillary action.Water's melting point (Choice A) is the temperature at which it changes its state from solid to liquid.The specific heat capacity (Choice C) of water pertains to the amount of heat energy needed to raise the temperature of a unit mass (usually one gram) of water by 1 °C.The buoyant force of water (Choice D) is the upward force on an object submerged or partially immersed in water, equal to the weight of the displaced water.

list.title: Question 40
list.content: Which option lists examples of evidence that can be used to support the theory of evolution?A.\hspace{1em}Sudden appearance of complex organisms, fossil record, homologous structuresB.\hspace{1em}Fossil record, homologous structures, size of organismsC.\hspace{1em}Homologous structures, speciation, fossil recordD.\hspace{1em}Speciation, the complexity of organisms, increasing size of organisms
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The fossil record provides evidence of evolution, as the sequence in which fossils appear matches the sequence that they would be expected to evolve. Homologous structures provide evidence of evolution as they provide evidence that organisms shared a common ancestor. Speciation provides evidence of evolution as when populations become reproductively isolated, then natural selection can act differently on those populations, resulting in the formation of new species.Choice Cis correct.Choices AandDare incorrect as the organisms becoming more complex does not necessarily correlate with evolution.Choice Bis incorrect, as the increasing size of organisms does not necessarily correlate with evolution.

list.title: Question 41
list.content: The overall structure of the flipper of a whale, in terms of bones and muscles, is similar to the overall structure of the limb of a horse.  What are these structures referred to as?A.\hspace{1em}Ancestral structuresB.\hspace{1em}Convergent structuresC.\hspace{1em}Analogous structuresD.\hspace{1em}Homologous structures
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because homologous structures refer to structures inherited from a common ancestor which are similar but often used for different functions.Choice Ais incorrect, as ancestral structures refer to structures present in an ancestor species, not structures found in present day species.Choice Bis incorrect as convergent structures are not a term used in biology.  Convergent evolution, on the other hand, leads to analogous structures.Choice Cis incorrect as analogous structures refer to structures used for the same function, which are significantly different when closely inspected.  Analogous structures also have different evolutionary origins.

list.title: Question 42
list.content:
Below is a micrograph of a bacterium,Marinomonas arctica, which is found in Arctic sea ice.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/e4c4e564-261e-4307-9a32-e06985877dc5/images/c403239f-99bf-4c69-919f-90bc200a737a/BI1258.png)

[Source: Gulf of Alaska Seamounts expedition, 2019.Marinomonas arctica.jpg. Wikimedia. Retrieved, September 25th 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Marinomonas_arctica.jpg. Copyright under Public Domain]Which row contains features of prokaryotic cells such asMarinomonas arctica?RibosomesCell wallDNA associated with proteinsA.\hspace{1em}80SYesNoB.\hspace{1em}80SYesYesC.\hspace{1em}70SNoNoD.\hspace{1em}70SYesNo
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because bacteria are prokaryotes, and prokaryotes have 70S ribosomes and a cell wall; they do not have proteins associated with the DNA.Choice Ais incorrect because prokaryotes do not have 80S ribosomes.Choice Bis incorrect because prokaryotes do not have 80S ribosomes or proteins associated with DNA.Choice Cis incorrect because prokaryotes do have cell walls.

list.title: Question 43
list.content: Which statement(s) is/arenottrue of eukaryotic or prokaryotic cells?I.\hspace{1em}Prokaryotic cells have a compartmentalised structure.II.\hspace{.8em}Only eukaryotic cells have a Golgi apparatus.III.\hspace{.6em}Only eukaryotic cells have membrane-bound organelles.A.\hspace{1em}II onlyB.\hspace{1em}I onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement IisNOTtrue of prokaryotic cells because they do not have compartmentalised structures. Compartmentalisation is a defining feature of eukaryotic cells, allowing them to carry out more complex and specialised functions.Statement IIis true of prokaryotic cells because they do not have a Golgi apparatus. The Golgi apparatus is a membrane-bound organelle, and only eukaryotic cells possess it.Statement IIIis true because membrane-bound organelles is a defining feature of eukaryotic cells. Prokaryotic cells lack membrane-bound organelles entirely.Choice Bis the correct answer as it only includesStatement I.Choices A, CandDare incorrect as they all includeStatement II,Statement IIIor both.

list.title: Question 44
list.content: Which statement is correct concerning the structure of DNA?A.\hspace{1em}A phosphate within a nucleotide is covalently bonded to a nitrogenous baseB.\hspace{1em}DNA molecules are made up of two parallel strands running in the same 3'-5' direction, linked by hydrogen bonds between complementary basesC.\hspace{1em}Bonding between adjacent phosphates and deoxyribose sugars forms the backbone of DNAD.\hspace{1em}Adenine is complementary to uracil, and cytosine is complementary to guanine
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Covalent bonding between adjacent phosphates and deoxyribose sugars forms the backbone of DNA;Choice Cis correct.Within nucleotides, the phosphate is covalently bonded to the deoxyribose sugar and the sugar is attached to the base;Choice Ais incorrect. DNA molecules are made up of two antiparallel strands (they are parallel but run in opposite directions, one runs 3’-5’ and the other 5’-3’), linked by hydrogen bonds between complementary bases;Choice Bis incorrect. In DNA, adenine is complementary to thymine;Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 45
list.content:
The image below is a micrograph of blood.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/f214bda4-8709-4714-9bb8-3bb5add61df2/images/224826e0-3233-47cd-aac2-c60d4bb234e4/micrograph%20of%20blood%20with%20phagocytes%20phagocytic%20white%20blood%20cells%20lymphocytes%20i.png)

Magnification: 800x[Source: Adapted from Berkshire Community College Bioscience Image Library. (2018).Connective Tissue: Human Blood Leukocyte Survey. Flickr. Retrieved April 4, 2022, from
https://www.flickr.com/photos/146824358@N03/26921278147. Copyright free]Identify the part of the cells labelled A and B.[2]Outline why blood is classified as a tissue.[1]State where the stem cells needed to produce red blood cells are located.[1]Progenitor cells are produced by dividing stem cells. These cells will eventually differentiate even further. Blood cells have a common progenitor cell. Describe the process that happens to these progenitor cells.[2]
list.markScheme: anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​arrow A points to the plasma membrane[1]→\ce{ -> }​arrow B points to the nucleus (in white blood cell)[1][2 marks maximum]Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​consists of different types of cellsORconsists of specialised cells[1]→\ce{ -> }​consists of red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer:The definition of tissue isdifferent types of cellsworking together (✓\checkmark✓). Blood consists ofred blood cells, white blood cells and platelets,(✓\checkmark✓) which each have a different role and work together.\hspace{1em}→\ce{ -> }​bone marrow[1][1 mark maximum]Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​through selective gene expressionORexpression of only tissue-specific genesORexpression of specific genes needed for the development of the blood cells[1]→\ce{ -> }​in response to changes in the environment[1]→\ce{ -> }​become specialised cellsORbecome cells with a specific roleORfunction[1]→\ce{ -> }​differentiate into red blood cells, white blood cells, and plateletsORbecome the different types of blood cells[1][2 marks maximum]Sample answer:Through selective gene expression(✓\checkmark✓) common progenitor cellsbecome specialised cells(✓\checkmark✓). In the case of blood, these cellsdifferentiate into red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 46
list.content: Which substance is insoluble in water and suitable for energy storage in animals?A.\hspace{1em}StarchB.\hspace{1em}GlucoseC.\hspace{1em}RiboseD.\hspace{1em}Glycogen
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis the correct answer because glycogen is the primary carbohydrate used for short- to medium-term energy storage in animals. It is insoluble in water, so it does not affect the water potential of the cytoplasm, making it ideal for storage.Choice Ais incorrect because starch is the carbohydrate storage molecule in plants, not animals. While starch is insoluble and suitable for energy storage in plants, it is not used by animals.Choice Bis incorrect because glucose is hydrophilic, soluble in water, and used for immediate energy, not long-term storage.Choice Cis incorrect because ribose is hydrophilic and is not used for energy storage. Instead, it is a component of RNA and nucleotides like ATP.

list.title: Question 47
list.content: To which domain do organisms with membrane-enclosed organelles belong to?A.\hspace{1em}EukaryotaB.\hspace{1em}ArchaeaC.\hspace{1em}EubacteriaD.\hspace{1em}Prokaryotes
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because Eukaryota are the only group with nuclei and membrane-bound organelles.Choice Bandchoice Care incorrect because organisms in these two domains (Archaea and Eubacteria) do not have membrane-enclosed organelles.Choice Dis incorrect because prokaryotes are not the name of a domain.

list.title: Question 48
list.content: Which of the following is the strongest evidence supporting the hypothesis that two populations are two different species?A.\hspace{1em}Allele frequencies differ between the two populations.B.\hspace{1em}The two populations are reproductively isolated.C.\hspace{1em}The DNA sequence of some genes was found to be different.D.\hspace{1em}The two populations are geographically isolated.
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because two reproductively isolated populations are a key component of the definition of a species.Choice Ais incorrect because allele frequencies often differ between different populations of the same species.Choice Cis incorrect because varying DNA sequences in genes confirms the existence of different alleles, not the existence of two species.Choice Dis incorrect because even when two populations are geographically isolated, they may still be the same species.

list.title: Question 49
list.content: Which characteristic(s) is/are observed in both natural selection and selective breeding?I.Favourable traits are selectedII.Increase in variationIII.Change is driven by the environmentA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis correct because in both selective breeding and natural selection, favourable characteristics are “selected” by either the environment (natural selection) or humans (selective breeding).Statement IIis incorrect because natural selection and selective breeding don’t increase variation, it influences the proportion of existing variants.Statement IIIis incorrect because selective breeding is not driven by the environment, it is driven by humans.Choice Ais, therefore, correct.Choices B,CandDare incorrect as they includeStatement IIand/orStatement III.

list.title: Question 50
list.content: Which statement applies to both mitochondria and prokaryotes?A.\hspace{1em}They both contain DNA.B.\hspace{1em}They both have flagella.C.\hspace{1em}They both contain lysosomes.D.\hspace{1em}They both have a cell wall.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Mitochondria and prokaryotes both contain their own DNA (Choice A).Choices B,CandDare incorrect as they are all only present in prokaryotes but not in mitochondria.

list.title: Question 51
list.content:
The micrograph below showsE. colicells.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/08c07fb2-97af-4b53-9301-240dba841c75/images/c6254d6c-a0ee-498b-bc2b-0f994ea000ad/BI0799A.png)

[Source: Adapted from Highton, P., 1968.E.coli image.jpeg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved 29th January 2023 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File.coli_image.jpg. Copyright under Creative CommonsCC0 1.0]Identify the structure labelled I in the micrograph.[1]If the magnification of the image is x36,000 and the length of cell II in the image is 54 mm, calculate the actual length of cell II in micrometres (µm).[2]Stateonefeature, other than the structure labelled I, that can be used to identify the cells in this micrograph as prokaryotic cells.[1]
list.markScheme: \hspace{1em}→\ce{ -> }​NucleoidORregion of circular DNAORregion of bacterial chromosomeORcircular DNA[1][1 mark maximum]\hspace{1em}Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:\hspace{1em}Structure I is thenucleoid(✓\checkmark✓).\hspace{1em}→\ce{ -> }​=(54000 µm36000)\left(\dfrac{\text{54000 µm}}{\text{36000}}\right)(3600054000 µm​)[1]\hspace{1em}→\ce{ -> }​= 1.5µm[1][2 marks maximum]\hspace{1em}Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:\hspace{1em}Magnification = x36000\hspace{1em}Length in image = 54mm x 1000 = 54000 µm\hspace{1em}Actual length\hspace{1em}=(54000µm36000)\left(\dfrac{\textbf{54000 µm}}{\textbf{36000}}\right)(3600054000 µm​)(✓\checkmark✓)\hspace{1em}=1.5 µm(✓\checkmark✓)Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​cell wall of peptidoglycan[1]→\ce{ -> }​cell in binary fission[1]→\ce{ -> }​no compartments in cellORno membrane bound organellesORno nucleus[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The cell doesnot havea nucleus, or any othermembrane bound organelles(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 52
list.content:
The table shows the nucleotide base sequence and genome size (number of base pairs, bp) for different species.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/129076a1-8fb2-48be-8b41-09d19f5d4455/images/e50f84c7-31b6-4770-bdd6-a3ae9bb089f4/BI0840.png)

[©Revision Village 2023. ]Which conclusion can be drawn, based on the table and your own knowledge?A.\hspace{1em}Genome size is proportional to the size of the species.B.\hspace{1em}The more closely related two species are, the more similar their base sequences.C.\hspace{1em}Humans have more genes than chimpanzees, mice and horses.D.\hspace{1em}The base sequence in the table for humans and chimpanzees is the same, therefore they have an identical genetic code.
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Species that share a recent common ancestor, such as humans and chimpanzees, are more likely to have similar base sequences. Over time, as species diverge and evolve, mutations accumulate in their base sequences. The longer two species have been separated from their common ancestor, the more mutations will have accumulated in their genomes. Therefore, species that are closely related have fewer accumulated mutations and more similar base sequences (Choice B).Choice Ais incorrect because genome size is not necessarily proportional to the size of the species. The genome size can vary significantly even among organisms of similar size, and organisms with similar-sized genomes, such as the horse and mouse vary greatly in size.Choice Cis incorrect because it is possible to have a larger genome size with a comparable, or even smaller, number of genes, depending on the amount of non-coding DNA and repetitive sequences present in the genome. Humans have a larger genome but a similar number of genes to the chimpanzee, mouse and horse.Choice Dis incorrect because there is a difference of one nucleotide base in the table between humans and chimpanzees. The genome of humans and chimpanzees is similar but not the same.

list.title: Question 53
list.content: Which of the following processes is most directly involved in the formation of nucleic acids such as DNA?A.\hspace{1em}HydrolysisB.\hspace{1em}CondensationC.\hspace{1em}CatabolismD.\hspace{1em}Translation
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Nucleotides are linked together by condensation reactions to form molecules of DNA (Choice B). The formation of DNA requires the removal of water for the joining of smaller molecules to form a larger molecule.The joining of nucleotides together can also be classified as an anabolic reaction but not as a catabolic reaction (Choice C). Catabolism is the breaking down of a large molecule into a smaller molecule. An example of catabolism is hydrolysis which is a reaction that breaks down a large molecule into a smaller molecule by adding water (Choice A).Translation is a process which follows the transcription of DNA (Choice D). It is where mRNA is used as a template by ribosomes to synthesize polypeptides.

list.title: Question 54
list.content:
The electron micrograph shows tobacco leaf mesophyll cells.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/277f4f8c-19fc-469f-b9a4-3305fde9bb35/images/b7225a3a-fdc9-4f9f-a955-1e86a3c869ff/BI1557.png)

[Adapted from: Marys, E. (n.d.).A Ultrathin Section of Vegetal Leaf Mesophyll Cells Showing Chloroplast Structure Stock Image - Image of discovery, botany: 211880559. Dreamstime.com. Retrieved April 23, 2024, from https://www.dreamstime.com/ultra-thin-section-transmission-electron-microscopy-tobacco-leaf-mesophyll-cells-showing-chloroplast-structure-ultrathin-image211880559. Royalty free image.]Identify structures X, Y, and Z in the micrograph.Structure XStructure YStructure ZA.\hspace{1em}mitochondrionnucleusplasma membraneB.\hspace{1em}chloroplastvacuolecell wallC.\hspace{1em}mitochondrionvacuoleplasma membraneD.\hspace{1em}chloroplastnucleuscell wall
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because structure X is a chloroplast, structure Y is the nucleus and structure Z is the cell wall.Choice Ais incorrect because X is a chloroplast, not a mitochondrion.Choice Bis incorrect because Y is the nucleus, not a vacuole.Choice Cis incorrect because both structures X and Y are mislabelled.

list.title: Question 55
list.content: What distinguishes uracil from thymine?UracilThymineA.\hspace{1em}Joined to a pentose sugarJoined to a hexose sugarB.\hspace{1em}Found in RNAFound in DNAC.\hspace{1em}Two-ring structureSingle-ring structureD.\hspace{1em}Complementary to cytosineComplementary to adenine
list.markScheme:
BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Uracil and thymine are nitrogenous bases found in two types of nucleic acids: DNA and RNA.Uracil is found in RNA, whereas thymine is found in DNA. (Choice B)In RNA, Uracil is not complementary to cystine, it is complementary with adenine, and thymine is also complementary to adenine
(Choice D).In both DNA and RNA, these nitrogenous bases are joined to a five-carbon sugar, also called a pentose sugar which has a ring structure, soChoice Ais incorrect.Both uracil and thymine are pyrimidines which are single-ring structures (Choice C). Adenine and guanine are purines which consist of two rings.

list.title: Question 56
list.content: Which technique estimates the divergence time between species based on genetic differences?A.\hspace{1em}Radioactive datingB.\hspace{1em}Molecular clock datingC.\hspace{1em}Comparative anatomyD.\hspace{1em}Studying fossil layers
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Molecular clock dating uses the genetic differences between species to estimate their times of divergence. This method relies on the assumption that mutations accumulate at a relatively constant rate over time. By comparing the DNA sequences of different organisms, scientists can estimate how long ago their last common ancestor lived.Choice Bis, therefore, correct.Radioactive dating is a method used to date rocks and other materials based on the known decay rates of radioactive isotopes.Choice Ais, therefore, not correct.Comparative anatomy involves comparing the structures of different organisms to understand their evolutionary relationships. While it can provide evidence of common ancestry and evolutionary trends, it does not offer a precise method for estimating the time of divergence between species based on genetic differences.Choice Cis, therefore, not correct.Studying the distribution of fossils within sedimentary rock layers establishes relative ages and the chronological order of geological and evolutionary events. Whilst it is essential for constructing the timeline of life on Earth, it does not use genetic differences to estimate divergence times between species.Choice Dis, therefore, not correct.

list.title: Question 57
list.content: Which structure is found in both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells?A.\hspace{1em}LysosomeB.\hspace{1em}RibosomeC.\hspace{1em}Golgi apparatusD.\hspace{1em}Nucleoid
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Unlike eukaryotes, prokaryotes lack a nucleus and membrane-bound organelles. However, like eukaryotes, prokaryotes contain ribosomes, a non-membrane-bound organelle required for protein synthesis. So, ribosomes are found in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes.Lysosomes (Choice A) and the Golgi apparatus (Choice C) are only found in eukaryotes. The nucleoid (Choice D) is only found in prokaryotes.

list.title: Question 58
list.content: What is the purpose of a biological dichotomous key?A.\hspace{1em}To identify how closely organisms are relatedB.\hspace{1em}To decide on the binomial name of an organismC.\hspace{1em}To identify speciesD.\hspace{1em}To find the last common ancestor of two species
list.markScheme: CSample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Dichotomous keys are tools that are used to identify different species based on their physical characteristics;Choice Cis correct.Choice Ais incorrect, as dichotomous keys are not used to identify how closely organisms are related.Choice Bis incorrect as dichotomous keys may help in identifying the binomial name of an organism, but they do not help with the decision of what to name a species.Choice Dis incorrect, as dichotomous keys do not allow scientists to identify the last common ancestor of two species.

list.title: Question 59
list.content: Which of the following best supports the idea that DNA is the universal genetic material in living organisms?A.\hspace{1em}All organisms have the same number of chromosomesB.\hspace{1em}All organisms translate proteins using ribosomesC.\hspace{1em}All organisms use DNA to pass on genetic informationD.\hspace{1em}All organisms reproduce sexually
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because the use of DNA is universal across all living organisms.Choice Ais incorrect because chromosome number varies widely across different species.Choice Bis true, but it is not a statement specific to DNA being the genetic material.Choice Dis incorrect because not all organisms reproduce sexually.

list.title: Question 60
list.content: Which is characteristic of both prokaryotes and viruses?I.Contain genetic codeII.Rely on host cell for metabolismIII.Surrounded by cell wallA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and IIC.\hspace{1em}II and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because both prokaryotes and viruses contain a genetic code. Only viruses rely on a host cell for metabolism, and only prokaryotes have a cell wall (Choice B, Choice C, andChoice D).

list.title: Question 61
list.content:
What is the actual width of the cell in this image? The scale bar represents 5μm.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/6b591b07-f59c-48c2-9596-d40067442d9b/images/bc4aab5d-8d13-40de-a819-a662fa2d63b0/BI1135.png)

[Source: Adapted from Itayba, Hebrew Wikipedia (2006, March 1).File: Electron Microscope Siemens, 1960.jpg - wikimedia commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved March 4, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Electron_microscope_Siemens,_1960.jpg Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}4μmB.\hspace{1em}40μmC.\hspace{1em}400μmD.\hspace{1em}4000μm
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The scale bar is shown to be 5μm in width, which is represented by 0.5cm on the ruler. The ruler indicates a total cell width of 4cm. Therefore, 8 scale bar widths will fit within the cell. Actual cell width = 8×\times×5μm = 40μm.Choices A, C, andDare incorrect.

list.title: Question 62
list.content: Which taxonomic group of organisms represents a domain?A.\hspace{1em}EukaryotaB.\hspace{1em}PlantaeC.\hspace{1em}ProtoctistaD.\hspace{1em}Animalia
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Eukaryota is one of only three domains - the other two being Archaea and Eubacteria.Choice B(Plantae) is one of the five kingdoms, not a domain.Choice C(Protoctista) andChoice D(Animalia) are also kingdoms.

list.title: Question 63
list.content:
Mesophyll cells are found in plants. Plant cells have unique characteristics that distinguish them from any other cell type.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/860825df-c83f-42a2-959f-858276f1b357/images/a1726d87-2824-4bf2-b6bb-b3a42c682716/BI0575.png)

[Source: Adapted from Zhang, N., Zhang, L., Zhao, L., Ren, Y., Cui, D., Chen, J., ... & Chen, F. (2017).iTRAQ and virus-induced gene silencing revealed three proteins involved in the cold response in bread wheat. Scientific reports, 7(1), 1-16.Retrieved March 27, 2022. From https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5548720/. Copyright under CC by 4.0]In the micrograph above, one of the cell parts is labelled X. What is the name of this structure?A.\hspace{1em}ChloroplastB.\hspace{1em}Central vacuoleC.\hspace{1em}Cell wallD.\hspace{1em}Starch granule
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice C- The cell wall is the outermost layer of plant cells just outside the plasma membrane.Chloroplasts (Choice A) are membrane-bound oval-shaped organelles (labelled Ch in the image) that are responsible for photosynthesis.The central vacuole (Choice B) is located in the centre of the cell, not towards the outside.  It is evident in the micrograph provided by the white, empty space in the middle of the cell.Starch granules (Choice D) are structures consisting of starch.  Their function is to store starch which is produced during photosynthesis. Starch granules are not visible in the micrgraph above.

list.title: Question 64
list.content: Which of the following represents the correct order for the traditional taxonomic hierarchy?A.\hspace{1em}Class→\rightarrow→Order→\rightarrow→FamilyB.\hspace{1em}Phylum→\rightarrow→Order→\rightarrow→ClassC.\hspace{1em}Order→\rightarrow→Genus→\rightarrow→FamilyD.\hspace{1em}Kingdom→\rightarrow→Order→\rightarrow→Phylum
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because the traditional hierarchy of taxa is a domain, kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, so class→\rightarrow→order→\rightarrow→family is in the correct order.Choice Bis incorrect because the class is above order.Choice Cis incorrect because the family is above genus.Choice Dis incorrect because the phylum is above order.

list.title: Question 65
list.content:
The micrograph shows a transverse section through a leaf.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/930381f2-72ec-4a7f-87fd-bbfe494edafc/images/5342f51d-2485-459c-a67e-cccaddcc8e57/BI0798A.png)

[Sourcefrom Berkshire Community College Bioscience Image Library,2018.Angiosperm Morphology Mesophyll Arrangement in Ligustrum (36198182664).jpg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved 29th January 2023 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Angiosperm_Morphology_Mesophyll_Arrangement_in_Ligustrum_(36198182664).jpg.Copyright under Creative Commons CC0 1.0]Identify an adaptation of this leaf for its function.[1]Identify the cell organelle that is found in particularly high numbers in the palisade mesophyll cells.[1]This micrograph shows a transverse section through a pancreatic acinar cell. Acinar cells are found in the exocrine tissue of the pancreas.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/930381f2-72ec-4a7f-87fd-bbfe494edafc/images/94be8ad7-3148-4d85-a6a2-a047e74af269/BI0798B.png)

[Source: Adapted from Howard, L., 2006.Pancreatic acinar cells.jpg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved 29th January 2023 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?search=pancreatic+cells&title=Special&go=Go&type=image&haslicense=unrestricted. Copyright under Public Domain]Explain how the structure of this cell is related to the function of the synthesis of proteins for release from the cell.[2]State why an electron microscope is needed to view the ultrastructure of the
acinar cells.[2]
list.markScheme: Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​large number of chloroplasts[1]→\ce{ -> }​large surface area[1]→\ce{ -> }​air spacesORspongy mesophyll[1]→\ce{ -> }​vascular tissuesORveinsORvascular bundles[1]→\ce{ -> }​stomataORguard cells[1]→\ce{ -> }​waxy cuticle[1]→\ce{ -> }​columnar cells in top layerORpalisade mesophylll[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The leaf has alarge surface area(✓\checkmark✓) for absorption of light.→\ce{ -> }​chloroplasts[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The organelle in greater abundance in the palisade mesophyll cells isthe chloroplast(✓\checkmark✓).Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​nucleus separated from cytoplasm by membraneANDallowing post-transcriptional modification of mRNA[1]→\ce{ -> }​large numbers of membrane-bound ribosomesORrough endoplasmic reticulumANDfor translationORsynthesis of proteins for secretion[1]→\ce{ -> }​large amount of rough endoplasmic reticulumANDlumen of rough endoplasmic reticulum is where polypeptides are folded and modified to form proteins[1]→\ce{ -> }​many vesiclesANDused to transport proteins from rough endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi apparatusORto carry proteins to plasmaORcell membrane for secretion[1]→\ce{ -> }​Golgi apparatusANDreceives proteins from rough endoplasmic reticulum and modifiesORpackages proteins for release from  cell[1][2 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The structure of this cell is adapted to its function because it contains a large amount ofrough endoplasmic reticulum. Theribosomeson the rough endoplasmic reticulum are the site of thesynthesisof thepolypeptides(✓\checkmark✓) and thesepolypeptidesare thenfolded and modified into functional proteinsin thelumenof therough endoplasmic reticulum(✓\checkmark✓).Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​electron microscopes have a higher resolution than light microscopes[1]→\ce{ -> }​electron microscopes have a higher magnification than light microscopes[1][2 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Electron microscopes havehigher magnification(✓\checkmark✓) andhigher resolution(✓\checkmark✓)  than light microscopes, so they allow more detail to be seen in smaller objects.

list.title: Question 66
list.content: Which of the following statements are reasons that RNA is believed to be the first genetic material?I.RNA can form spontaneously when nucleotides are presentII.RNA contains ribose as its sugarIII.RNA can function as enzymesA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and IIIC.\hspace{1em}II and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:RNA is believed to be a potential candidate for the first genetic material due to its ability to form spontaneously from nucleotides (Statement I). RNA molecules, known as ribozymes, can catalyze chemical reactions (Statement III), including their own replication. This is a key reason why RNA is considered the first genetic material—unlike DNA, RNA can both store information and perform enzymatic functions, making it a strong candidate for early life processes.Choice Bis correct.Choice Aonly includedStatement Iand notIII, so it is incorrect.While it is true that RNA contains ribose as its sugar component (Statement II), the presence of ribose is not a primary reason for RNA being considered the first genetic material. Both RNA and DNA contain sugars in their structures, but the key point in favour of RNA as the first genetic material is its ability to form spontaneously.Choices CandDincludedStatement IIand so are incorrect.

list.title: Question 67
list.content: Which row correctly describes the DNA and chromosomes of Eubacteria cells?ShapeDNA with histonesNumber of chromosomes\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}CircularYesMore than one\hspace{1em}B.\hspace{1em}LinearYesMore than one\hspace{1em}C.\hspace{1em}CircularNoOne\hspace{1em}D.\hspace{1em}LinearNoOne
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Eubacteria have a single chromosome composed of DNA and not associated with histones(Choice C).Choice Ais incorrect because prokaryotes' DNA is not associated with histones and they only have one chromosome.Choice Bis incorrect because prokaryotes do not have linear DNA, their DNA is not associated with histones, and they do not have more than one chromosome.Choice Dis incorrect because prokaryotic chromosomes are not linear.

list.title: Question 68
list.content:
The diagram depicts nucleosomes.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/c8553f1d-6638-4d08-afb4-f0102866653d/images/d415e617-f6e7-4cc7-af88-69b27c34f16c/BI0893A.png)

[Source: Adapted from CNX OpenStax, (2016, May).File: Figure 16 03 02.png.Wikimedia commons. Retrieved May 28, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Figure_16_03_02.png. Copyright under CC-BY-4.0]What is the role of X?A.\hspace{1em}Joins nucleosomes togetherB.\hspace{1em}Packages DNA into nucleosomes through coilingC.\hspace{1em}DNA replicationD.\hspace{1em}Carries genetic material
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because X labels the core histone proteins which help package the DNA into nucleosomes through coiling.Choice Ais incorrect because X is not linker DNA which extends from one nucleosome to the next, connecting nucleosomes with one another.Choice Cis incorrect because enzymes carry out DNA replication, not histone proteins.Choice Dis incorrect because DNA carries genetic material, not the core histone proteins.

list.title: Question 69
list.content: Viruses, compared to living organisms, are very small. Which other characteristic listed below distinguishes viruses from unicellular living organisms?A.\hspace{1em}Contain genetic materialB.\hspace{1em}Contain cytoplasmC.\hspace{1em}Lack enzymesD.\hspace{1em}Genetic material is surrounded by a capsid
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because The structure of all viruses includes the presence of a capsid, which surrounds the genetic material (Choice D). Both viruses and living organisms contain genetic material (Choice A). Unicellular living organisms contain cytoplasm (Choice B).  Some viruses lack enzymes, but not all viruses lack enzymes (Choice C).

list.title: Question 70
list.content: Cyanobacteria are prokaryotes that can perform photosynthesis. Which structural feature is common to both cyanobacteria and plant cells?A.\hspace{1em}ChloroplastB.\hspace{1em}Cell wallC.\hspace{1em}PiliD.\hspace{1em}Mitochondria
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotes are one of the earliest organisms to have evolved the process of photosynthesis. Plant cells are eukaryotes that can also perform photosynthesis, but they evolved after prokaryotes. Some of the features that distinguish prokaryotes from plant cells (which are eukaryotes) are membrane-bound organelles such as chloroplasts (Choice A) and mitochondria (Choice D) which are present in plant cells but absent in prokaryotes. According to the endosymbiotic theory, cyanobacteria evolved into chloroplasts during the early evolutionary process of eukaryotic cells.Pili are found in prokaryotes but not in plant cells (Choice C). Even though the composition of the cell wall in prokaryotes is different (made of a peptidoglycan polymer) from the cell wall in plant cells (made up of cellulose), the presence of the cell wall is a common feature found in both prokaryotes and plant cells (Choice B).

list.title: Question 71
list.content: Which statements are characteristics of a DNA molecule?I.The two strands are identical.II.The two strands are antiparallel to one another.III.The sugar-phosphate backbone is held together by covalent bonds.A.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A DNA molecule is made up of two antiparallel strands of nucleotides. Antiparallel means that both strands are geometrically parallel but oriented in opposite directions (Option II). One of the strands is in the direction of 5' to 3', whereas the other strand is in the direction of 3' to 5'. The backbones, made of alternating sugar and phosphate groups, are held together by covalent sugar-phosphate bonds (Option III). Both of these strands are joined together by the hydrogen bonds between the complementary base pairs.DNA strands are not identical (Option I) because identical would mean that they have the same nucleotide arrangement, instead they are complementary to each other.

list.title: Question 72
list.content: How does the genetic code provide evidence of universal common ancestry?A.\hspace{1em}The genetic code of mitochondria is identical to the genetic code of the nucleus in eukaryotes.B.\hspace{1em}Each amino acid is coded for by only one codon.C.\hspace{1em}Mutations cannot cause changes in the sequence of bases in the genome.D.\hspace{1em}The genetic code is the same across all three domains of life, with just a few exceptions.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The genetic code is largely the same in all known organisms. There are a few exceptions such as mitochondrial DNA which can vary slightly in codon assignments for specific amino acids, and some bacterial species. ThereforeChoice Dis correct .Choice Ais incorrect because the genetic code used in mitochondria is similar to the genetic code used in the nucleus of eukaryotic cells but not entirely the same.Choice Bis incorrect because the genetic code is degenerate. There are 64 possible codons in the genetic code, but only 20 amino acids. As a result, some amino acids are coded for by more than one codon, providing redundancy and flexibility in protein synthesis.Choice Cis incorrect because mutations are changes in the genetic code. As a result, mutations play a significant role in generating genetic diversity and are a driving force in the process of evolution.

list.title: Question 73
