list.content: Which statement(s) is/are a necessary requirement for the evolution of the first cells?I.DNA having the ability to catalyse reactionsII.Polymerisation of carbon compoundsIII.Spontaneous formation of vesiclesA.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyB.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:There is evidence that simple carbon-containing molecules were present on Earth, millions of years ago, however, for early cells to evolve, they would have needed these simple molecules to form more complex structures such as polysaccharides and polynucleotides (Statement II). Phospholipids can spontaneously form vesicles (Statement III) or microspheres (microscopic hollow spheres made from a phospholipid bilayer), which resemble the plasma membrane of a small cell, this would allow for early cells to develop a different internal chemical environment from their surroundings.Choice Bis correct.DNA cannot catalyse reactions,Statement Iis incorrect.Choices A, CandDare incorrect as they includeStatement I.

list.title: Question 74
list.content:
The diagram below shows the apparatus used in the experiments conducted by Miller and Urey.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/36cfad3c-78b8-41fc-a4d4-262aa9f660a0/images/3b57ece6-ab77-4c10-83ed-7c8f13d7ec98/image.png)

[Source: Carny. (2008, February 4). File: Miller-Urey Experiment-EN.SVG. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 20, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Miller-Urey_experiment-en.svg.  Copyright free]Describe how this experiment showed that the origin of life was possible on early Earth.[3]
list.markScheme: Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​ammonia (NH3_33​), methane (CH4_44​) and Hydrogen (H2_22​) were the major gases present in the early atmosphere[1]→\ce{ -> }​heat was used to simulate higher temperatures[1]→\ce{ -> }​steam was passed through ammonia (NH3_33​), methane (CH4_44​) and Hydrogen (H2_22​)ORthrough a mixture of compounds[1]→\ce{ -> }​electricity was used to simulate lightning[1]→\ce{ -> }​resulting mixture was cooled down[1]→\ce{ -> }​the amino acidsORorganic carbon compounds needed for life were produced[1][3 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Miller and Urey conducted experiments which showed that the compounds present in theearly atmosphere(methane, ammonia and hydrogen(✓\checkmark✓)) could be used to make the organic carbon compounds necessary for life.  They did this by heating up water andpassing the steam(✓\checkmark✓) through ammonia, methane and hydrogen and by usingelectricity to simulate the lightning(✓\checkmark✓).  They found that these conditionscreated amino acids(✓\checkmark✓) and other organic carbon compounds.

list.title: Question 75
list.content:
The diagram shows the haploid number of chromosomes in a gamete. What could be the polyploid number of chromosomes for this organism?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/51e41ed5-56e6-42d0-8db1-e48caf3e68dd/images/9ac6bf4f-ee2e-4489-9079-5a64545af1f9/BI0714.png)

[Adapted from: Source Ehamberg. (2010, May 10).Filevs diploid.svg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved June 30, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File.svg Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}6B.\hspace{1em}24C.\hspace{1em}3D.\hspace{1em}4
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Polyploidy is when an organism develops a mutation where they have more than two sets of the haploid number of chromosomes.Choice Bis correct as it has 8 sets of 3 chromosomes.Choice Ais incorrect, as it is the diploid number, which is double the haploid number.Choice Cis incorrect, as it is the haploid number of chromosomes.Choice Dis incorrect because it is not a multiple of the haploid number.

list.title: Question 76
list.content: In a cladogram, what is represented by a node?A.\hspace{1em}A new trait that is shared by two organismsB.\hspace{1em}The most recent common ancestor between speciesC.\hspace{1em}A group of organisms with a common ancestorD.\hspace{1em}The most genetically distant organisms
list.markScheme: BSample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Nodes on a cladogram are a splitting point that represent the most recent ancestor between species;Choice Bis correct.A node does not represent a new trait shared by two organisms;Choice Ais incorrect. A group of organisms with a common ancestor is a clade, not a node;Choice Cis incorrect. The most genetically distant organism on a cladogram is an outgroup, not a node;Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 77
list.content: Which statement provides evidence for the endosymbiotic theory?A.\hspace{1em}Phospholipids readily form bilayers.B.\hspace{1em}Chloroplasts possess a double membrane.C.\hspace{1em}RNA is self-replicating.D.\hspace{1em}Mitochondria possess a single membrane.
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The endosymbiotic theory states that larger prokaryotes engulfed smaller prokaryotes, which were the ancestors of modern chloroplasts and mitochondria. The smaller prokaryotes were engulfed via endocytosis, so they have their original membrane as well as the membrane of the larger prokaryote.Choice Bis correct.Choice Ais incorrect because it provides evidence for the evolution of plasma membranes not endosymbiotic theory.Choice Cis incorrect because it provides evidence for the mechanism of inheritance.Choice Dis incorrect because mitochondria have a double membrane.

list.title: Question 78
list.content:
Which arrow correctly identifies a node in the cladogram?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/69c93911-093d-43fa-b75c-1769ca9016d1/images/c793b196-2c02-4fd1-91e0-0de4b74073d4/BI0266%20primate%20cladogram%20i.png)

[Adapted from: Source Bockman, P. (2011, October 3).File: Primate cladogram.jpg. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 14, 2022, from https:// commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Primate_cladogram.jpg CC-BY-SA-3.0]
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A node is the point where species diverge.Choice Dis correct.Choices AandBare incorrect as they point to the middle of the line, so they do not represent divergence.Choice Cis incorrect as it points to a species.

list.title: Question 79
list.content: Which isnota cause of anthropogenic species extinction?A.\hspace{1em}OverhuntingB.\hspace{1em}DeforestationC.\hspace{1em}Introduction of new diseasesD.\hspace{1em}Asteroids
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Anthropogenic species extinction is extinction caused by human activities.  Asteroid impacts are natural events and are not caused by human activities. However, they have played a significant role in past mass extinctions, such as the event that led to the extinction of the dinosaurs.Choice Dis therefore correct.When humans overhunt (Choice A) it can lead to a decline in populations and, in some cases, extinction. Deforestation (Choice B) is another human activity. The clearing of forests for purposes such as agriculture, logging or urban development, can destroy habitats and disrupt ecosystems, leading to extinction of species that rely on those habitats. When humans introduce new diseases to ecosystems (Choice C), either accidentally or deliberately, it can have devastating effects on native species and bring about extinction.Choices A,BandCare therefore incorrect.

list.title: Question 80
list.content:
Which part of the cell is labelled with the letter P?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8c50f434-e0ff-47b5-b17a-389a3e9bd2a2/images/aeaa4f06-2d32-4828-8370-65b4b9af9ffc/BI0395%20image.png)

[Source: Adapted from Itayba, Hebrew Wikipedia. (2016, March 1).Category: Electron Microscope Images.Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Electron_microscopy.jpg. Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}VacuoleB.\hspace{1em}LysosomeC.\hspace{1em}NucleoidD.\hspace{1em}Nucleus
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais incorrect, as the photo shows an animal cell, which can contain smaller, single membraned vacuoles, but the nucleus is much larger.Choice Bis incorrect as lysosomes are smaller and have a single membrane.Choice Cis incorrect as nucleoids are only present in prokaryotes and are not membrane bound.

list.title: Question 81
list.content: Which of the following statement concerning analogous structures is/are correct?I.They are formed through convergent evolutionII.They perform the same or similar functions in different organismsIII.They evolve from a common ancestorA.\hspace{1em}II onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Analogous structures refer to structures found in different species which serve a similar function (Statement II) but are not the result of common ancestry, they are formed through convergent evolution (Statement I), which is when different organisms evolve similar structures but have not arisen from a common ancestor.Choice Bis correct.Analogous structures do not evolve from a common ancestor (Statement III);Choices CandDare incorrect.Choice Ais incorrect because it only involvesstatement II.

list.title: Question 82
list.content:
The image shows changes in coverage to mixed dipterocarp forests in Southeast Asia over the last 100 years.Which is not a factor that contributed to these changes?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a1fefead-ab2a-4ce6-991b-34aa2eb33cde/images/ede73a61-24fa-43b8-b1ae-1135b7e67858/BI0904_A4.2.png)

[Source: Adapted from San Jose. (2006, February 8). File: map of east asia.png - wikimedia commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved July 10, 2023 from URL https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Map_of_East_Asia.png. Copyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}Building of new roads to mining sitesB.\hspace{1em}Poaching of endangered speciesC.\hspace{1em}Planting of rubber plantationsD.\hspace{1em}Building of hydroelectric dams
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The image shows the loss of forests in Southeast Asia over 100 years. Poaching of endangered species does not result in deforestation;Choice Bis correct.Building new roads to mining sites involves clearing land to mine sites, soChoice Ais incorrect. Planting rubber plantations requires clearing forests to plant rubber trees, soChoice Cis incorrect.  Building hydroelectric dams can lead to flooding of forests and irreparable damage to trees, soChoice Dis also incorrect.

list.title: Question 83
list.content:
Biologists use the binomial naming system to name every organism on the planet. The binomial name for the platypus isOrnithorhynchus anatinus. Which statement(s) below are true for the binomial naming system and the platypus?I.\hspace{1em}The genus for the platypus isOrnithorhynchus.II.\hspace{.7em}The binomial naming system is based on an international agreement
between scientists.III.\hspace{.4em}The name,Ornithorhynchus anatinusis unique to platypus species.A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:All three statements are correct. The first part of the binomial name is the genus, the second part is the species which is unique to platypus species. The binomial system and binomial names are agreed between biologists at international congresses.

list.title: Question 84
list.content:
The image shows the vascular tissue in the leaves of a corn plant (Zea mays). What property of water is not demonstrated in the vascular tissue of the plant?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/e57087dc-a110-4437-ad90-1eed35cfde39/images/2ff3d4f0-e8cd-4249-9307-e959ca83e346/BI1224.png)

[Source: Adapted from Berkshire Community College  Bioscience Image Library. (2017, October 3).Angiosperm morphology: The closed and collateral vascular bundle in Zea. Flickr. Retrieved September 11, 2023, from https://www.flickr.com/photos/146824358@N03/37215761790. Copyright free]A.\hspace{1em}CohesionB.\hspace{1em}AdhesionC.\hspace{1em}Universal solventD.\hspace{1em}High thermal conductivity
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The vascular tissue of a plant contains the xylem, which transports water from the roots to the leaves of the plant and the phloem, which transports soluble organic compounds that are made during photosynthesis. Although water has a high thermal conductivity, which means that it can transfer heat easily, this is not demonstrated by the movement of water in the xylem;Choice Dis correct.Cohesion is the ability of water molecules to stick to each other via their hydrogen bonds, this allows a continuous column of water to be transferred up the xylem;Choice Ais incorrect. Adhesion is the ability of water to stick to surfaces, this allows water to stick to the inner surface of the xylem, which helps to maintain the integrity of the continuous water column;Choice Bis incorrect. Water is a universal solvent, which means that many nutrients can be dissolved in it and be transported via the xylem and phloem to where they are needed in the plant;Choice Cis incorrect.

list.title: Question 85
list.content:
According to the cladogram, which two primates are the most closely related?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/008ac188-a233-4bb5-b8bb-1f6a59da105e/images/1afb59aa-b10a-4467-b0d5-c7f223838826/BI0263.png)

[Adapted from: Source Bockman, P. (2011, October 3).File: Primate cladogram.jpg. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 14, 2022, from https:// commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Primate_cladogram.jpg CC-BY-SA-3.0]A.\hspace{1em}New world monkeys and old world monkeysB.\hspace{1em}Lorises and lemursC.\hspace{1em}Lemurs and humansD.\hspace{1em}Apes and humans
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Humans and apes (Choice D) are the most closely related because they shared a common ancestor more recently than the other primates, such as new world and old world monkeys (Choice A), Lorises and Lemurs (Choice B) and Lemurs and Humans (Choice C).

list.title: Question 86
list.content: Which of the following supports the theory that multicellularity has evolved repeatedly?I.Sexual reproduction is more common in multicellular organisms, allowing for greater genetic diversity.II.Modern eukaryotes are believed to have evolved from larger prokaryotes which engulfed but didn't digest beneficial smaller prokaryotes.III.Fossil evidence indicates that different taxa developed multicellularity at different times in evolutionary history.A.\hspace{1em}III onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Fossils provide evidence that different taxa developed multicellularity at different times in evolutionary history, indicating that multicellularity developed independently in different taxa;Statement IIIis correct.Choice Ais correct.Although multicellular organisms more commonly reproduce sexually than single-celled organisms, leading to greater genetic diversity, this does not directly support the idea of multicellularity evolving repeatedly. It highlights one of the advantages of sexual reproduction, however, single-celled organisms tend to reproduce rapidly by asexual reproduction, which can lead to more effective dispersal and the withstanding of harsher conditions.Statement Iis not true.Statement IIis not true as it summarises the theory of endosymbiosis rather than supports multicellularity evolving repeatedly.Choices B,CandDare incorrect, as they all containStatement IIand/orStatement III.

list.title: Question 87
list.content: Which of the following is the correct format for species names according to the binomial naming system?A.\hspace{1em}Genus + SpeciesB.\hspace{1em}Genus + speciesC.\hspace{1em}Genus+speciesD.\hspace{1em}Genus+Species
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because only the genus name should be capitalised, it should come before the species name, and both should be in italics.Choices AandDare incorrect because only the genus name should be capitalised.Choice Bis incorrect, as the genus and species name should be in italics.

list.title: Question 88
list.content: Which describes the  differences between the main isolating mechanisms in sympatric and allopatric speciation?Sympatric SpeciationAllopatric SpeciationA.\hspace{1em}Behavioural isolationPolyploidyB.\hspace{1em}Geographic isolationTemporal isolationC.\hspace{1em}Temporal isolationGeographic isolationD.\hspace{1em}Geographic isolationPolyploidy
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Allopatric speciation occurs when populations of the same species become geographically isolated, preventing them from interbreeding. This can be caused by various factors such as rivers, mountains or volcanoes erupting. Allopatric actually means ‘different geographical area’’.  Sympatric speciation is the evolution of a new species from an existing one without geographical isolation (sympatric actually means ‘same geographical area’). The factors that can cause this type of speciation include behavioural and temporal isolation.Choice Cis, therefore, correct because temporal isolation is common in sympatric speciation, and geographic isolation leads to allopatric speciation.Choice Ais incorrect because although behavioural isolation can lead to sympatric speciation, polyploidy does not lead directly to allopatric speciation.Choice Bis incorrect because geographical isolation is not part of the process of sympatric speciation, and, temporal isolation does not directly lead to allopatric speciation.Choice Dis incorrect because geographic isolation is not part of the process of sympatric speciation, and polyploidy does not lead directly to allopatric speciation.

list.title: Question 89
list.content: Bacteriophages and coronaviruses are both viruses that affect living organisms. Which structures are present in both bacteriophages and coronaviruses?I.cytoplasmII.capsidIII.genetic materialA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because bacteriophages and coronavirus have a capsid and genetic material, and do not have cytoplasm (Choice A, Choice B, andChoice D).

list.title: Question 90
list.content: What feature of chloroplasts provides evidence for the endosymbiotic theory?A.\hspace{1em}They have their own nucleus.B.\hspace{1em}They have a single membrane.C.\hspace{1em}They contain 70S ribosomes.D.\hspace{1em}They contain a thylakoid membrane.
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The endosymbiotic theory states that larger prokaryotes engulfed smaller prokaryotes, which were the ancestors of modern chloroplasts and mitochondria. The smaller prokaryotes contained their own 70S ribosomes which were distinct from the host cell's 80S ribosomes.Choice Cis correct.Choices AandBare incorrect because chloroplasts do not have a nucleus and have a double membrane.Choice Dis incorrect because although chloroplasts do contain a thylakoid membrane, this is not evidence for the endosymbiotic theory.

list.title: Question 91
list.content: Which statement explains why DNA is evidence of common ancestry?A.\hspace{1em}All organisms have an identical DNA base sequence.B.\hspace{1em}All organisms contain DNA.C.\hspace{1em}Closely related species contain the same alleles.D.\hspace{1em}More recently evolved species have more similar DNA.
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because the presence of DNA in all organisms reflects a universal lineage, providing evidence of common ancestry. All organisms use the same four nucleotides (adenine, thymine, cytosine, and guanine) and the same genetic code to translate DNA into proteins, which supports the idea of a shared evolutionary origin.Choice Ais incorrect because while all organisms share common sequences in their DNA, their base sequences are not identical. Differences in DNA sequences accumulate over time, and species with more recent common ancestors have more similar DNA.Choice Cis incorrect because organisms that are closely related share many similarities in their DNA but their alleles are not all identical.Choice Dis incorrect because all organisms, living and extinct, contain DNA, not only recently evolved species.

list.title: Question 92
list.content: Which of the following statements read true for differences between prokaryotes and eukaryotes?I.Prokaryotes have DNA associated with histones, while eukaryotic cells have naked DNA.II.Eukaryotes have linear chromosomes, while prokaryotes have circular chromosomes.III.Most prokaryotes have a singular chromosome, whilst most eukaryotic somatic cells contain at least two chromosomes.A.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyB.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotes typically have DNA that is not associated with histones and is often referred to as ‘naked’. In eukaryotes, histone proteins help package the DNA into structural units called nucleosomes. This makesStatement Ifalse.Eukaryotic chromosomes are typically linear and located within the nucleus, while most prokaryotic organisms have a single circular chromosome found in a nucleoid region without a surrounding nuclear membrane. This makesStatement IItrue.Most prokaryotes contain a single circular chromosome, while eukaryotic somatic cells are generally diploid with paired chromosomes. ThereforeStatement IIIis true.Seeming as onlyStatements IIandIIIare true, this makesChoice Bthe correct answer to the question.Choices A, CandDare all incorrect as they includeStatement I.

list.title: Question 93
list.content: Whole genome sequencing has been used to sequence the genomes of many species. Which of the following are potential future uses of whole genome sequencing?A.\hspace{1em}Identifying disease-causing alleles.B.\hspace{1em}Sequencing the genomes of bacteria and fungi.C.\hspace{1em}Advancing personalised medicine.D.\hspace{1em}Identifying evolutionary relationships between species.
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because personalised medicine is a potential future application of whole genome sequencing. While it is not yet widely available, the continued study of individual genomes could lead to treatments tailored to an individual’s genetic profile, improving the effectiveness of medical interventions.Choice Ais incorrect because whole genome sequencing has already been used to identify disease-causing alleles which is improving understanding of genetic diseases.Choice Bis incorrect because whole genome sequencing is currently being used to sequence the genomes of disease-causing bacteria and viruses.Choice Dis incorrect because whole genome sequencing of a range of species is currently being used to identify evolutionary relationships and common ancestors; it is not a novel use.

list.title: Question 94
list.content:
Which of the following shows the correct structure of a DNA nucleotide?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/22716090-ebb2-445b-8107-c2459a247ff8/images/9ab33f74-e805-4dfb-838b-794a9ffbf1db/BI1394ii.png)

[©Revision Village 2025]
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because it shows the nitrogenous base bonded to the 1’ carbon of the pentose sugar and the phosphate bonded to the 5’ carbon. Even though the structure is inverted the bonding remains accurate, as this is how it would appear on the antiparallel DNA strand.Choice Ais incorrect because it shows the phosphate bonded to the oxygen on the pentose sugar, which is not possible.Choice Cis incorrect as it shows incorrect bonding for the nucleotide base, which is attached to the 2’ carbon. The phosphate is shown bonded to the 3’ end of the sugar, which would be part of the next nucleotide subunit.Choice Dis incorrect as it shows incorrect bonding for the nucleotide base, again connected to the 2’ carbon.

list.title: Question 95
list.content: Which of the following would provide evidence for two individuals belonging to different species?I.Differences in genome base sequenceII.Differences in genome sizeIII.Differences in chromosome numberA.\hspace{1em}III onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because onlystatement IIIis evidence of organisms being different species. Organisms of the same species will normally have the same number of chromosomes, except in the case of some genetic conditions such as Down syndrome in humans. So organisms having different numbers of chromosomes is evidence for them being separate species.Statements IandIIcan both vary within a species due to mutations.

list.title: Question 96
list.content:
The image shows the extinct North Island giant moa (Dinornis novaezealandiae), a flightless bird that was native to New Zealand. The Moa became extinct in the last 600 years, during the current sixth mass extinction.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/273945a5-5442-41c1-8f0d-83b2ae441eb6/images/b1dfd7ea-6184-436b-992e-995929493172/BI0910.png)

[Source: Adapted from Michael, B. H. (2012). File: Euryapteryx.jpg - Wikimedia Commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved July 21, 2023 from URL https://
commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Euryapteryx.jpg. Copyright under CC BY 3.0
]State the key difference between the current sixth mass extinction and the previous mass extinctions.[1]State one possible cause of the extinction of the Moa.[1]Outline the physical evidence scientists have collected indicating that the Moa existed.[1]In the past, scientists thought that the kiwi (Apteryx haastii), a flightless bird based in New Zealand, was the Moa’s closest living relative.  However, this has been disproven. State what evidence scientists may have found to disprove this relationship.[1]The Moa’s closest living relatives are the South American Tinamou (Tinamus major), which have the ability to fly. Explain why these birds are less likely to go extinct than the Moa.[1]Evidence suggests that the Tinamou and Moa shared a common ancestor, but they evolved independently from each other when they were geographically isolated millions of years ago. Explain the evolution of the Tinamou with reference to natural selection.[3]Another animal at risk of extinction is the Javan rhinoceros (Rhinoceros sondaicus), shown in the image below. There are thought to be fewer than 80 in the world. Suggest two methods scientists could use to prevent its extinction, with a reason for each.[2]

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/273945a5-5442-41c1-8f0d-83b2ae441eb6/images/d8f49dc3-c88c-451b-96e7-b2940ee2bce2/BI0910b.png)

[Source: Adapted from Nelson, S. (2012, July 20). Category: Rhinoceros Sondaicus. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved July 21, 2023 from URL https://
commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category: Rhinoceros_sondaicus. Copyright under CC BY 3.0
]
list.markScheme: Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​sixth mass extinction is mostly anthropogenicORmainly caused by human activityWHEREASthe previous ones were (primarily) caused by natural events[1]→\ce{ -> }​the sixth mass extinction event isFASTERthan the previous ones[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:The current sixth mass extinction is appears more closely related to the Moa[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Scientists may have found that the Kiwi haddissimilar DNA sequences(✓\checkmark✓) to the Moa, and more similar DNA sequences to another organism.Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​Tinamous can fly so can escape predatorsORhunters more easily[1]→\ce{ -> }​Tinamous can build their nests high up in trees so that their young are less vulnerable[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Tinamous are less likely to go extinct than the Moa, as they canbuild their nests highup in trees so that theiryoung are less vulnerable(✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​geographic isolation of the TinamouORMoa lineage meant that different populations were subjected to varying environmental conditions[1]→\ce{ -> }​random mutations lead to genetic  variation[1]→\ce{ -> }​genetic variation may have resulted in
