age[1]→\ce{ -> }​reproduced and passed on alleles[1]→\ce{ -> }​repeated for many generations[1][3 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Thegeographic isolationof the Tinamou lineage meant that different populations were subjected todifferent environmental conditions(✓\checkmark✓).Random mutationsin the populations resulted ingenetic variation(✓\checkmark✓), which may have resulted indifferent physical and behavioural traits(✓\checkmark✓). Some traits among Tinamous, such as camouflage or flight abilities, would have been moreadvantageousthan others (✓\checkmark✓), resulting inhigher survival rates(✓\checkmark✓). Therefore, these organisms with advantageous traits were able topass on their allelestosuccessive generations(✓\checkmark✓).Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​breeding programmesORcarefully selecting individuals for breeding,REASONto increase numbers of rhinoORpopulation sizeORgenetic diversityORincrease chance of survival of offspringORproduce offspring that can later be released into the wild;ORfreeze eggs and spermORgametesREASONto preserve genetic diversityORto use IVF and a closely related rhino species to produce more Javan rhinos[1]→\ce{ -> }​habitat protectionORrestoration projects,REASONto provide safe spaces for rhinoORto provide enough resources for rhino in natural area[1]→\ce{ -> }​place rhinos into zoosORnature reserves,REASONto protect from poaching,ORhunting,ORhabitat loss,ORfor researchORfor monitoringORpublic awarenessOReducationORfundingORto have animals that can be released into the wild after catastrophic events,ORsevere disease, in natural habitat[1]→\ce{ -> }​change laws to protect rhinos,REASONto reduce huntingORpoachingORexport of rhino hornORuse of rhino horn[1]→\ce{ -> }​sequence DNA of as many Javan rhinos as possibleREASONto preserve genetic diversityORdifferent alleles[1][2 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Scientists could prevent the extinction of the Javan rhinoceros by introducingbreeding programmestoincreasethe rhinopopulation(✓\checkmark✓) or starthabitat restoration projectsto provide enough area with enoughresources to supportthe rhino (✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 97
list.content:
The diagram below represents the three domains of life.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/292dca29-d444-488e-b4ca-9141aee0f532/images/921a7728-af80-441f-a1f0-9779a836ac28/BI0251ii.png)

[ © Revision Village 2022]Which row has the correct names for the domains?Domain 1Domain 2Domain 3\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}ArchaeaProkaryotesEukaryote\hspace{1em}B.\hspace{1em}ProtistaProkaryotaEukaryota\hspace{1em}C.\hspace{1em}ProtistaEubacteriaEukaryota\hspace{1em}D.\hspace{1em}EubacteriaArchaeaEukaryota
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because the three domains of organisms are Archaea, Eubacteria and Eukaryota.Choice Ais incorrect because prokaryote is not the name of one of the domains.Choice Bis incorrect because Protista and prokaryota are not the names of domains.Choice Cis incorrect because Protista is not one of the domains.

list.title: Question 98
list.content:
Match the labelled structure (Q-T from the diagram) with its primary structure.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/38b38de6-6717-482a-9a4f-f546274b7e7d/images/ce1af51c-d72e-48f9-8b0a-39700a6e5d99/Ed2790.png)

[© Revision Village 2025. Created with BioRender.com]Contains genetic informationProvides support and protectionRegulates the passage of substancesA.\hspace{1em}SQRB.\hspace{1em}TQSC.\hspace{1em}TQRD.\hspace{1em}TRQ
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:In the diagram, T indicates naked DNA, and this is the genetic material for the cell. Q indicates the cell wall, which provides structural support and protection. R indicates the cell membrane, which regulates the passage of substances in and out of the cell, and S indicates the cytoplasm, which is the site of metabolic reactions in the cell. Therefore,Choice Cis the correct answer because it correctly matches the functions of the structures that are indicated by the letters in the diagram.Choice A, Choice B, andChoice Ddo not correctly match the functions of the structures indicated by the letters in the diagram.

list.title: Question 99
list.content: Which of the following is a reason that the Earth is considered to be in ‘The Goldilocks zone’, but Saturn is not?A.\hspace{1em}The Earth is at an optimal distance from the Sun for water to be in three states, whereas Saturn has rings of iceB.\hspace{1em}Saturn is able to form rings, but the Earth does not have ringsC.\hspace{1em}The Earth is at an optimal distance from the Sun for water to remain liquid, whereas Saturn is notD.\hspace{1em}The Sun is visible from Earth but not from Saturn
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The Goldilocks zone, or the habitable zone, refers to the range of distances a planet can be from the Sun, which leads to conditions on the planet being suitable for water to remain liquid. Earth's position in this zone allows for water to remain in a liquid state, while Saturn's distance from the Sun places it outside this zone, making it too cold for liquid water to exist.Choice Cis correct.Choice Ais incorrect because the Goldilocks zone refers to liquid water, not all three states.Choice Bis incorrect, as the presence or absence of rings is not a determining factor for whether a planet is in the habitable zone. Both Earth and Saturn have distinct characteristics, but the habitable zone concept primarily focuses on the presence of liquid water on the surface.Choice Dis incorrect as the sun is visible from both Saturn and Earth and does not connect to the idea of the Goldilocks zone.

list.title: Question 100
list.content: Which of the following are correct percentages of bases in a sample of DNA?AdenineCytosineGuanineThymineA.\hspace{1em}10%25%30%35%B.\hspace{1em}10%15%15%10%C.\hspace{1em}20%30%30%20%D.\hspace{1em}20%20%30%30%
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:DNA molecules consist of 4 nitrogenous bases: adenine (A), cytosine (C), guanine (G) and thymine (T). Chargaff's rule states that A will pair with T and C will pair with G. The percentages of all 4 bases should add up to 100% because there are no other bases present.Choices A and Dare incorrect because the amount of A is not equal to the amount of T, and the amount of C is not equal to the amount of G.Choice Bis incorrect because the sum of all percentages does not add up to 100%.

list.title: Question 101
list.content:
The male firefly (P. pyralis) signals to potential female mates by flashing its lights in specific patterns. Females will only respond to light patterns produced by their own species.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/4bb67863-e258-4a4f-b20c-e75935003089/images/d2b81121-d7da-4354-9e50-45429c3e396a/BI0715A.png)

[Source: Adapted from Gallagher, J. (2014, June 3).File: Firefly - Photinus pyralis, Woodbridge, Virginia.jpg - Wikimedia ...Wikimedia commons. Retrieved July 1, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Firefly_-_Photinus_pyralis,_Woodbridge,_Virginia.jpg Copyright under CC BY 2.0]Identify the form of reproductive isolation that fireflies exhibit. Justify your answer.[2]Suggestonepossible advantage of this mating ritual.[1]All fireflies seen today have diverged from the same ancestral species. Explain how speciation is responsible for the large variety of firefly species.[3]
list.markScheme: Anytwoof the following:→\ce{->}​behavioural type[1]→\ce{->}​the different light patternsORthe mating behaviourORrituals[1]→\ce{->}​prevents the fireflies from mating with different speciesORinterspecies breeding[1][2 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The fireflies are exhibitingbehaviouralisolation (✓\checkmark✓), as the specificmating ritualsthat they perform (✓\checkmark✓),prevent interspecies breeding(✓\checkmark✓).Anyoneof the following:→\ce{->}​allows females to find males of the same speciesORallows fireflies to identify members of the opposite sex[1]→\ce{->}​allows females to select the fittest malesORmates[1]→\ce{->}​brighterORfaster flashes can increase the chance of matingORbe more attractive to females[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:An advantage to the firefly of exhibiting this type of behaviour is that it allows females to findmalesof thesame species. (✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following:→\ce{->}​speciation is the formation of a new speciesORthe process by which populations divergeORevolve over time to become distinct species[1]→\ce{->}​members of a population are isolated from one anotherORbarriers prevent interbreeding[1]→\ce{->}​allopatric speciation involves a physical barrier separating groupsORsympatric speciation involves a non-physical barrier separating groups[1]→\ce{->}​over time selective pressures affect each group differentlyORdifferent mutations occur within each groupORover time each group can develop different behavioursORdifferent characteristics develop due to natural selection[1]→\ce{->}​allele frequencies change in each populationORgenetic drift[1]→\ce{->}​groups are unable to interbreedORare reproductively isolated when the barrier is removedORcannot reproduce to produce fertile offspring[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Speciation is when a group of organisms change so much that they can no longer mate together to producefertile offspring(✓\checkmark✓). This can come about by a group of fireflies beingseparated or isolated(✓\checkmark✓) from the original population, say by being blown to an island. Over time, the separated group will change. For example the climate may be colder so those individuals with a larger abdomen havemore chance of surviving(✓\checkmark✓) as they lose less heat, and so they pass on their favourable alleles and theallele frequencyin the populationchanges(✓\checkmark✓). When the separated group encounter fireflies from the original population, they canno longer reproduce together(✓\checkmark✓) as their abdomens are so different.

list.title: Question 102
list.content: Which of the following is true for the biological species concept?A.\hspace{1em}Organisms within the same species can interbreed to produce fertile offspringB.\hspace{1em}Organisms within the same species can interbreed to produce infertile offspringC.\hspace{1em}Species are groups of organisms with shared traitsD.\hspace{1em}Species are groups of organisms without shared traits
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:According to the biological species concept, a species is a group of organisms that can interbreed to produce fertile offspring.Choice Ais correct.Choice Bis incorrect as it refers to infertile offspring.Choices CandDare incorrect because they refer to the morphological species concept.

list.title: Question 103
list.content: Below is a list of conservation strategies:I.Establishing a zoo to breed endangered species in controlled environmentsII.National parks and protected areas where species live in their natural habitatIII.Seed banks that store genetic material from endangered plant speciesWhich of the statements describes an example of in-situ conservation?A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis false because a zoo is an example of ex-situ conservation (when species are protected outside of their natural habitat).Statement IIis true because a National park is an example of in-situ conservation, focusing on protecting species in their natural habitats.Statement IIIis false because a seed bank is an example of ex-situ conservation.Choice Bis therefore correct as it only gives the trueStatement II.Choices A, CandDare all incorrect as they include one or more of the falseStatements IandIII.

list.title: Question 104
list.content: Which of the following statements about the dipolarity of the water molecule are true?I.\hspace{1em}Oxygen attracts the shared electrons stronger than hydrogen.II.\hspace{.7em}Hydrogen atoms are partially negative.III.\hspace{.4em}The shared electrons spend more time closer to oxygen.A.\hspace{1em}I and IIB.\hspace{1em}II and IIIC.\hspace{1em}I and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis correct. Oxygen has a higher electronegativity compared to hydrogen. This means that oxygen will attract shared electrons more strongly.Statement IIis false. Since the shared electrons between oxygen and hydrogen spend more time near oxygen,  the hydrogen in the water molecule becomes partially positive.Statement IIIis true because oxygen attracts the shared electrons more strongly resulting in the shared electrons spending more time closer to the oxygen atom.

list.title: Question 105
list.content: Which of the following is a similarity between transcription and translation?A.\hspace{1em}Both use DNA as a templateB.\hspace{1em}Both occur in the 5' to 3' directionC.\hspace{1em}Both involve binding to a ribosomeD.\hspace{1em}Both involve mRNA splicing
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Both transcription and translation synthesize strands from 5' to 3'.Only transcription uses DNA as a template, whereas translation uses mRNA as a template (Choice A).Binding to ribosomes takes place only in translation but not in transcription (Choice C).mRNA splicing takes place only during post-transcriptional modifications and not in post-translational modifications (Choice D).

list.title: Question 106
list.content: Which of the following isnota reason that scientists look for the presence of water on planets as a sign of extraterrestrial life?A.\hspace{1em}Water is a necessary resource for most living organismsB.\hspace{1em}Most enzymes catalyse reactions in solutions containing waterC.\hspace{1em}Water molecules can stick to each otherD.\hspace{1em}Water is a universal solvent
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The ability of water molecules to stick to each other, known as cohesion, is relevant to its behaviour and interactions but is not a direct reason for scientists to look for water as a sign of extraterrestrial life. ThereforeChoice Cis the correct answer.Choice Ais incorrect, as water being necessary for most living organisms is why scientists look for water as a sign of extraterrestrial life.Choice Bis incorrect as enzymes, which are biological catalysts, typically function within aqueous environments. Water's unique properties enable it to serve as a solvent for chemical reactions, which are crucial for the biochemical processes of living organisms.Choice Dis incorrect as, due to the polarity of water, it can dissolve a wide range of substances, allowing chemical reactions to occur in water. This property is, therefore, relevant to the support of life processes.

list.title: Question 107
list.content:
The diagram below shows the structure of 2 different monomers.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/6860c05f-e311-4527-b0db-a0edb0faa6be/images/5fdb0628-9704-4354-a136-ddb85c904c1d/BI0437.png)

[Source: Adapted from CNX OpenStax College. (2013). Illustration from Anatomy & Physiology, Connexions Website. Retrieved September 11, 2022, from https ://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:217_Five_Important_Monosaccharides-01.jpg Copyright under CC BY 3.0]State the name of the following:structure A[1]structure B[1]State the name of a polymer which contains the following molecules:structure A[1]structure B[1]
list.markScheme: →\ce{->}​structure A: α-glucose[1]→\ce{->}​structure B: ribose[1]→\ce{->}​structure A: starchORglycogenORamyloseORamylopectin[1]→\ce{->}​structure B: ribonucleic acidORRNA[1]

list.title: Question 108
list.content:
Early cladograms were constructed by comparing structures of organisms. The cladogram on the left is based on structure and the cladogram on the right is based on comparing the DNA sequence of a particular gene.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/71a6aa14-4f15-478b-a24a-ca99ed0fd98f/images/cbe839a7-5b86-466c-bb39-f4cbda23ccd1/BI0551.png)

[Source: Left: Adapted from Milinkovitch, M., Thewissen, J. (1997).Even-toed fingerprints on whale ancestry. Nature 388, (622–623).  Retrieved January 4, 2023, from https://doi.org/10.1038/41650. Copyright under open access; Right: Adapted from Masato Nikaido, Alejandro P. Rooney, Norihiro Okada. (1999, August 31).Phylogenetic relationships among cetartiodactyls based on insertions of short and long interpersed elements: Hippopotamuses are the closest extant relatives of whales. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences. Retrieved January 4, 2023, from https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.96.18.10261.  Copyright-free.]What is the reason that the cladogram based on the DNA sequences is a more reliable representation of the sequence of divergence among clades than the cladogram based on structures?A.\hspace{1em}Structures are not inherited when species diverge.B.\hspace{1em}DNA does not change over time while structures can change over time.C.\hspace{1em}Similar structures can be coded for by different genes in genetically distant organisms.D.\hspace{1em}There are many different structures that are coded for by the same DNA sequence.
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Morphological traits, or structures, are useful for creating cladograms. However, cladograms created by comparing such traits may be inaccurate because distantly related organisms can have structures that appear similar but have different genetic bases. The appearance of similar structures with a different evolutionary basis is not evidence of relatedness, but rather is evidence of convergent evolution. So, one reason the cladogram based on the DNA sequences is more reliable than the cladogram based on structures is that similar structures can be coded for by different genes in genetically distant organisms.Choice Ais incorrect because structures are inherited when species diverge, and the inheritance of structures is beneficial for constructing cladograms.  This is because shared structures are sometimes, but not always, evidence of genetic relatedness.Choice Bis incorrect because DNA does change over time. Scientists look at sequences of changes in DNA to determine evolutionary relatedness.Choice Dis incorrect because different structures are generally coded for by different DNA sequences.

list.title: Question 109
list.content:
The electron micrograph below shows a cell of the bacteriumVibrio cholerae. Which of the labelled structures maintains the cell’s shape and protects the cell from lysing during osmosis?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/736cd18e-ee65-4f82-8af4-eb1a43c8be73/images/5dc39b3e-60d2-488c-8d82-06070c9413d6/BI0494.png)

[Source: Blokesch, M. & Schoolnik, G.K. (2007).Serogroup Conversion of Vibrio cholerae in Aquatic Reservoirs. PLoS Pathog 3(6): e81. Retrieved March 15, 2022, from https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.ppat.0030081.Copyright under CC BY 4.0]
list.markScheme:
BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The cell membrane of prokaryotes is surrounded by a rigid cell wall. The cell wall provides shape and structure to the organism. It also prevents the cell from bursting when the cell takes up water through osmosis.  The cell wall is located between the cell membrane and the capsule, a sticky outer layer of polysaccharide. The cell wall is shown in the image below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/736cd18e-ee65-4f82-8af4-eb1a43c8be73/images/186347c3-bad0-4ecf-8cb6-3d8e5822df69/BI0494A.png)

list.title: Question 110
list.content: What determines the overall size of a eukaryotic genome?A.\hspace{1em}The number of genesB.\hspace{1em}The number of chromosomesC.\hspace{1em}The amount of proteinD.\hspace{1em}The total amount of DNA
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The number of genes contributes to the overall size of the genome, but it is not the sole determinant. Eukaryotic genomes contain a significant amount of noncoding DNA.  The amount of this non-coding DNA is a major contributing factor to the overall size of a eukaryotic genome.Choice Ais incorrect.Chromosomes vary greatly in the number of genes and noncoding DNA they contain. Simply knowing the number of chromosomes in a genome does little to describe the size of the genome.Choice Bis incorrect.Choice Cis incorrect because a genome is a measure of only the amount of DNA and does not consider protein.Choice Dis the correct choice because it is the total amount of DNA in a genome that determines the size of that genome, regardless of the function of the DNA.

list.title: Question 111
list.content: Which of the following options correctly identifies the forms of DNA and the types of ribosomes found in prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?Prokaryotic DNAEukaryotic DNAProkaryotic RibosomesEukaryotic RibosomesA.\hspace{1em}LinearCircular80S70SB.\hspace{1em}CircularLinear80S80SC.\hspace{1em}CircularLinear70S80SD.\hspace{1em}LinearLinear70S70S
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotic cells have circular DNA and 70S ribosomes, while eukaryotic cells have linear DNA and 80S ribosomes. Therefore,Choice Cis correct.Choices A, BandDare incorrect because they do not have the correct combinations.

list.title: Question 112
list.content: What would make one DNA molecule more stable than another DNA molecule?I.More G-C base pairs than A-T base pairsII.More hydrogen bonds between base pairsIII.Greater distance between A-T base pairs than G-C base pairsA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}III onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because the stability of the DNA helix molecule is affected by the nucleotide composition. There are 3 hydrogen bonds between the G-C base pairs, and only 2 between the A-T base pairs, therefore, more G-C pairs (Statement I)  means a greater number of hydrogen bonds (Statement II).Choice Ais incorrect as it does not include both correct statements.The distance between the A-T base pairs and the G-C base pairs is equal, and even if the distance between A-T were greater, it would not add to stability (Statement III).Choices BandDare therefore incorrect as they includeStatement III.

list.title: Question 113
list.content: Which process is most likely responsible for the origin of mitochondria as a eukaryotic cell organelle?A.\hspace{1em}OsmosisB.\hspace{1em}ExocytosisC.\hspace{1em}ApoptosisD.\hspace{1em}Endocytosis
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice A– Osmosis is an example of passive transport, which involves the movement of water across a semi-permeable membrane.Choice B- Exocytosis is an example of active transport that moves large molecules out of the cell to the cell’s exterior.Choice C– Apoptosis is the process of programmed cell death.Choice D- Endocytosis is an example of active transport that moves large molecules, parts of a cell, or a cell from the cell’s exterior, into a cell’s interior. This is in accordance with the endosymbiotic theory, which is the most likely process by which mitochondria came to be eukaryotic organelles.

list.title: Question 114
list.content: Which set of bonds found in nucleic acids are correctly identified in the table below?Bonds between phosphates and pentose sugarsBonds between nucleotide basesA.\hspace{1em}CovalentHydrogenB.\hspace{1em}HydrogenCovalentC.\hspace{1em}CovalentCovalentD.\hspace{1em}HydrogenHydrogen
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because the nucleic acid backbone is held together by covalently bonded sugars and phosphates, while the nucleotide bases are held together by hydrogen bonds.Choice Bis incorrect because the types of bonds are reversed.Choice Cis incorrect because the bonds between nucleotides are hydrogen bonds, not covalent bonds.Choice Dis incorrect because the bonds between phosphates and pentose sugars are covalent, not hydrogen bonds.

list.title: Question 115
list.content:
Hershey and Chase conducted an experiment to investigate whether DNA or protein serves as the genetic material.  They cultured 2 batches of viruses, one in a medium containing radioactive35S and one in radioactive32P. They then introduced each batch of viruses to separate cultures of bacteria. After allowing time for the viruses to infect the bacteria, the culture solutions were centrifuged to separate the viral remains from the bacterial cells, forming two layers, the pellet and the supernatant.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a244248b-19cc-4c6d-8c47-7a84200748e2/images/b03df4bf-dda9-4a31-ba13-5c0ee871323f/BI0894A.png)

[© Revision Village 2023. Created with Chemix (https://chemix.org)]Which component of the tube would provide evidence that DNA is the genetic material?A.\hspace{1em}Supernatant with radioactive35SB.\hspace{1em}Pellet with radioactive35SC.\hspace{1em}Supernatant with radioactive32PD.\hspace{1em}Pellet with radioactive32P
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because the bacterial cells form the pellet, and they would contain32P as DNA  contains phosphorus but not sulphur. The viruses cultured in32P incorporated it into their DNA, and they infected the bacteria with this radioactive DNA.Choices AandCare incorrect as the bacteria with the radioactive DNA should be found in the pellet, whereas the supernatant contains the viral remains.Choice Bis incorrect as if the bacteria in the pellet contained35S then this would indicate that protein, which contains sulphur, and not phosphorus, serves as the genetic material.

list.title: Question 116
list.content:
The diagram shows the structure of a DNA fragment.Which letter points to the bonds that easily break and reform?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a626ffc3-c2e5-4f07-aa13-46af1143e26b/images/b46d0542-b068-4146-8497-4b93a1868de1/BI0038.png)

[Source: Adapted from User: Madprime. (2010, March).File: DNA chemical structure jp.svg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 15, 2022, fromhttps://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: DNA_chemical_structure_jp.svg.Copyright under CC-SA 3.0]
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The bonds between the nitrogenous bases holding the two strands together are hydrogen bonds. Hydrogen bonds typically break and reform easily; thereforeChoice Bis the correct answer to the question.The nitrogenous bases consist of single and double covalent bonds (Choice A) between nitrogen and carbon atoms. Deoxyribose sugars have single covalent bonds (Choice C) between the carbon atoms forming the pentose sugar. There are covalent bonds between the phosphate and sugar and between the phosphate and base (Choice D). Covalent bonds do not typically break and reform easily.

list.title: Question 117
list.content:
Which organelle is the site of protein synthesis?A.B.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a6800fc1-62df-4a80-8975-f59d30b437e0/images/4ddade12-66a0-4c52-9381-f4a372e51019/BI0398_A.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a6800fc1-62df-4a80-8975-f59d30b437e0/images/5ea410ae-53a6-41e4-8caf-b19f7ff71d5b/BI0398_B.png)

C.D.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a6800fc1-62df-4a80-8975-f59d30b437e0/images/bd018c3a-4311-4d55-9892-7a1ceea2227f/BI0398_C.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a6800fc1-62df-4a80-8975-f59d30b437e0/images/95800f00-ea95-43f4-a140-576cd381a05d/BI0398_D.png)

[Source A: Adapted from Itayba, Hebrew Wikipedia. (2016, March 1).Category: Electron Microscope Images. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Electron_microscopy.jpg Copyright under CC BY 3.0.Source B: Adapted from: Openstax. (2016, May 18).File:0313 endoplasmic reticulum B en.png - Wikimedia Commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:0313_Endoplasmic_Reticulum_b_en.png Copyright under CC BY 3.0.Source C: and3k, & caper437. (2009, June 25).File: chloroplast in leaf of anemone sp Tem 85000x.png - Wikimedia Commons. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File.png Copyright under CC BY 3.0Source D: Murphy, F. (2016, August 10).Free picture: Thin, section, ebola, virus. PIXNIO. Retrieved June 19, 2022, from https://pixnio.com/science/microscopy-images/ebola-hemorrhagic-fever-virus/thin-section-containing-the-ebola-virus Copyright free]
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because it shows the rough endoplasmic reticulum, which has bound ribosomes that synthesise proteins.Choice Ashows the nucleus which contains the genetic information and controls the activity of the cell.Choice Cshows a chloroplast, the site of photosynthesis.Choice Dindicates the golgi apparatus which packages and transports proteins.

list.title: Question 118
list.content:
What information can be deduced from the cladogram?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a7b55663-83dc-4b1c-8dc9-a1a4836ae09c/images/d887ade3-cdd4-4ad6-89ee-2d5616c78b8b/cladogram%20of%20primates%20i.png)

[Adapted from: Source Bockman, P. (2011, October 3).File: Primate cladogram.jpg. Wikimedia commons. Retrieved June 14, 2022, from https:// commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Primate_cladogram.jpg CC-BY-SA-3.0]A.\hspace{1em}Lorises and Tarsiers share a common ancestor.B.\hspace{1em}Old world monkeys and New world monkeys have the same DNA sequences.C.\hspace{1em}Human and Lemur species are the same age.D.\hspace{1em}Tarsiers and Lemurs do not share a common ancestor.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:All organisms on the same cladogram share a common ancestor.Choice Ais correct.Choice Bis incorrect as old world and new world monkeys have evolutionarily split on the cladogram, so there are differences in their DNA sequence.Choice Cis incorrect as this cladogram does not show the age of the species.Choice Dis incorrect because lemurs and tarsiers are on the same cladogram so they do share the same ancestor.

list.title: Question 119
list.content:
What feature distinguishes fungal hyphae and striated muscle from the two cell types shown in the images?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/aa05a687-8639-4d5b-b98e-676e515e3db9/images/cb9d1305-aecb-4b44-9d15-1ffb1d245817/bi0756.png)

[Source: Adapted from CNX OpenStax. (2016, May 27).File04 00 00.jpg.Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved March 5, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Figure_04_00_00.jpg Copyright under CC by 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}They are multinucleate.B.\hspace{1em}They only have one nucleus.C.\hspace{1em}They have unusually large cells that contain only one nucleus.D.\hspace{1em}They contain mitochondria.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Fungal hyphae and striated muscle are both exceptions to the cell theory as they are much larger than typical cells and are multinucleate.Choice Bis incorrect as the diagrams depict onion epidermis cells and mast cells, which each contain one nucleus.Choice Cis incorrect as both fungal hyphae and striated muscles contain multiple nuclei.Choice Dis incorrect as fungal hyphae, striated muscle AND the cells in the diagram all contain mitochondria.

list.title: Question 120
list.content: What can result in speciation among organisms living in the same location?A.\hspace{1em}Behavioural isolationB.\hspace{1em}Geographic isolationC.\hspace{1em}Stabilising selectionD.\hspace{1em}Directional selection
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Speciation comes about through reproductive isolation which can result from behavioural isolation, in which a population of a species can no longer interbreed with other populations of the species. For example, some segments of a population may respond to a particular mating call or mating behaviour not expressed by another segment of the population.Geographic isolation (Choice B) occurs when populations are prevented from interbreeding because they are in different physical locations. In this question they are in the same location, therefore this is incorrect. Stabilising selection (Choice C) is a type of natural selection that promotes an intermediate phenotype, so extremes are reduced, and it does not result in speciation. Directional selection (Choice D) is a type of natural selection that promotes an extreme phenotype, but the selection is in one direction so it does not divide the population and so does not lead to speciation. Only if selection occurs in both directions (divergent selection) does it tend to lead to speciation.

list.title: Question 121
list.content: Which of the following are often barriers to hybridisation between species?I.A given animal hybrid species has an even, as opposed to an odd number of chromosomes.II.Two species of flowering plants produce gametes at different times of the year.III.Behavioural barriers exist due to variations in bird song between species.A.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyB.\hspace{1em}II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyD.\hspace{1em}II and III only
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct.  Cross-pollination is unlikely if two species of flowering plants produce gametes at different times of year (Statement II).  Mating, and thus hybridisation, is unlikely or impossible if members of one bird species fail to recognise the mating calls of another bird species (Statement III).Statement Iis not a barrier to hybridisation because, typically, animals with even numbers of chromosomes in their somatic cells can reproduce sexually, but those with odd numbers are usually sterile due to an inability of their cells to undergo meiosis.

list.title: Question 122
list.content: Which of the following molecules are classified as nucleic acids?I.ATPII.rRNAIII.DNAA.\hspace{1em}I and IIB.\hspace{1em}I and IIIC.\hspace{1em}II and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis false. ATP (adenosine triphosphate) is a nucleotide, not a nucleic acid. It is a single molecule, not a long chain (polymer) of nucleotides, which is what defines nucleic acids like DNA and RNA.Statement IIis true. Ribosomal RNA (rRNA) is a type of RNA, which is one of the two major types of nucleic acids (the other being DNA). It is a polymer of ribonucleotides, synthesised during transcription, and plays a role in protein synthesis.Statement IIIis true. DNA is a polymer of deoxyribonucleotides. It serves as the hereditary material in most organisms.Note that the correct answer includes the two molecules whose names end in ‘NA’, which stands for nucleic acid - DNA and RNA.Choice Cis, therefore, the correct answer as it only includes the two trueStatements IIandIII.Choices A, BandDare incorrect as they include the falseStatement I.

list.title: Question 123
list.content: Which of the following correctly pairs the structure with the type of cell in which it is found?StructureType of cellA.\hspace{1em}Nucleoid regionAnimalB.\hspace{1em}Cell wallProkaryoticC.\hspace{1em}ChloroplastFungal cellD.\hspace{1em}Sap vacuoleProkaryotic
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because nearly all prokaryotic cells possess a cell wall that provides structure, support, and protection.Choice Ais incorrect because a nucleoid region is characteristic of a prokaryotic cell, not an animal cell.Choice Cis incorrect because chloroplasts are found in plants and some algae cells, but not fungi.Choice Dis incorrect because sap vacuoles are characteristic of plant cells, not prokaryotic cells.

list.title: Question 124
list.content: Which of the rows below shows the correct characteristics of viruses, prokaryotes and eukaryotes?VirusProkaryoteEukaryoteA.\hspace{1em}Genome is DNA or RNAGenome is DNA onlyGenome is DNA onlyB.\hspace{1em}Rely on host cell for nutritionRely on host cell for nutritionDoes not rely on host cell for nutritionC.\hspace{1em}Synthesises ATP for energy supplySynthesises ATP for energy supplySynthesises ATP for energy supplyD.\hspace{1em}Capsid presentCapsid presentCapsid present
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because viruses contain DNA or RNA as their genome. Viruses rely on host cells for nutrition, but prokaryotes and eukaryotes do not (Choice B). Prokaryotes and eukaryotes synthesise ATP, but viruses do not (Choice C). Capsids are present in viruses but not in prokaryotes or eukaryotes (Choice D).

list.title: Question 125
list.content: The okapi looks like a small-sized giraffe and has stripes that resemble the zebra. It lives in the Ituri Forest in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Okapis eat the leaves and buds of trees they can reach. They also graze on grass and ferns and eat fruit. Okapis tend to be solitary animals and the mother gives birth to one offspring which continues to be dependent on the mother’s milk for six months. When they are four to five years old, they are mature and can breed, but only with other okapis.Which of the following statements is applicable to the okapi?I.Okapi is a hybrid of a giraffe and a zebraII.Okapi is an herbivoreIII.Okapi is its own speciesA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I and III only
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Okapi is a herbivore(II)because it only eats plants. Okapi is a species(III)since it can interbreed and produce fertile offspring.They are not a hybrid of a giraffe and a zebra (I), even though they look like one.

list.title: Question 126
list.content: The table provides information on planets within a distant galaxy that are a similar size to Earth. Which planet is most likely to be able to support life as we know it on Earth?Gases in the atmosphereSurface temperature /°\degree°CIs there evidence of water being present?A.\hspace{1em}Oxygen and carbon dioxide- 45YesB.\hspace{1em}Nitrogen and sulfur dioxide15YesC.\hspace{1em}Oxygen and hydrogen100YesD.\hspace{1em}Helium and hydrogen450No
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The gases present in a planet’s atmosphere can influence whether life is supported, as different organisms may evolve to interact with different gases. For example, extremophiles on Earth can survive in low-oxygen (hypoxic) environments and derive energy from compounds such as hydrogen sulfide or hydrogen gas. However, while life can exist in a range of atmospheric conditions, the most critical factor for supporting life as we know it is the presence of liquid water at a suitable temperature. Atmospheric composition plays a role, but it is secondary to temperature and water availability.Planet B has a surface temperature of 15°\degree°C, which is well within the range where water remains in the liquid state, and evidence of water is present;Choice Bis correct.Although there is water present on Planet A, the surface temperature is -45°\degree°C, which means that the water would be frozen;Choice Ais incorrect.Although there is water present on Planet C, the surface temperature is 100°\degree°C, which is the boiling point of water at 1 atm pressure, therefore water would be in a gaseous form.Choice Cis incorrect.There is no evidence of water being present on Planet D, and its surface temperature is 450°\degree°C, which is far too high for any known form of life to survive.Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 127
list.content: The cohesive and adhesive properties of water allow xylem vessels to transport water inside plants.Which of the following are correct descriptions of how these properties are related to water transport in plants?CohesiveAdhesive\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.Polar water molecules are attracted to the hydrophilic cell walls in xylem.\hspace{1em}B.\hspace{1em}Water molecules are polar, so are able to dissolve ionsPolar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.\hspace{1em}C.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form oxygen bonds.Water molecules are polar, so are able to dissolve ions\hspace{1em}D.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to the hydrophilic cell walls in xylem.Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Water is cohesive because it is a polar molecule. The oxygen atom in one water molecule forms a hydrogen bond with the hydrogen atom of another water molecule. In xylem vessels water is attracted to the hydrophilic regions of the cell wall and hydrogen bonds are formed.  This an accurate description of the adhesive properties of water in the context of water transport in plants (Choice A). These statements are reversed inChoice D.Ions dissolve in water, but this is not related to the cohesive (Choice B) or adhesive (Choice C) properties of water.

list.title: Question 128
list.content: Which of the following rows correctly pairs the cell type with its nuclear characteristic?Cell typeNuclear stateA.\hspace{1em}Phloem sieve tube elementsNo nucleusB.\hspace{1em}Skeletal muscle cellsSingle nucleusC.\hspace{1em}Red blood cellsSingle nucleusD.\hspace{1em}Aseptate fungal hyphaeNo nucleus
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because phloem sieve tube elements lose their nucleus as they mature to facilitate the transport of sugars.Choice Bis incorrect because skeletal muscle cells are multinucleated to accommodate their length.Choice Cis incorrect because mature red blood cells lack a nucleus. They jettison the nucleus when mature to increase the haemoglobin capacity of oxygen transport.Choice Dis incorrect because aseptate fungal hyphae have a continuous cytoplasm containing many nuclei.

list.title: Question 129
list.content: Which definitions are matched to the correct form of diversity?Ecosystem diversityGenetic diversitySpecies diversityA.\hspace{1em}Different habitats, communities and ecological processesThe type of alleles in a populationGenetic variation within a speciesB.\hspace{1em}The number of species and their abundance in an areaPhenotypic variation in a communityGenetic variability within a speciesC.\hspace{1em}Variety and abundance of different ecosystems in a geographical areaGenetic variability within a species or populationThe number of species and their abundance in an areaD.\hspace{1em}Different habitats, communities and ecological processesThe total number and type of epigenetic markers in a populationThe variety of all life on Earth
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Ecosystem diversity is defined as the variety and abundance of different ecosystems present in a geographical area. Genetic diversity is the genetic variability within a species or population. Species diversity is the number and relative abundance of species found in a specific area. ThereforeChoice Cis correct.Choice Ais incorrect because genetic diversity does not only refer to the type of alleles in a population but the number of different alleles in a population.Choice Bis incorrect because phenotypic variation refers to differences in observable characteristics, not genetic diversity, and the definition of ecosystem diversity shown in row B is actually the definition for species diversity.Choice Dis incorrect as genetic diversity does not relate to the control of the expression of genes (epigenetics) within a population and the variety of all life on Earth is the definition for biodiversity.

list.title: Question 130
list.content: Which is the most significant factor in the loss of global biodiversity being experienced in the 21st century?A.\hspace{1em}IndustrialisationB.\hspace{1em}Human population growthC.\hspace{1em}Invasive plant speciesD.\hspace{1em}Deforestation
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because the rapid growth in human population (which has included a doubling in the period 1960-2020) has put pressure on all the Earth’s resources that humans rely upon. In doing so, habitat loss has had a major negative effect on thousands of species across all five kingdoms.Choices A, CandDare all incorrect; whilst they are all factors contributing to global biodiversity loss, they are not the overarching cause. The question asks for the ‘most significant factor’, which is human population growth.

list.title: Question 131
list.content: Which is a key difference between homologous and analogous structures?A.\hspace{1em}Homologous structures are similar due to ancestry, but analogous structures are similar due to convergent evolution.B.\hspace{1em}Homologous structures are similar due to ancestry, but analogous structures are similar due to divergent evolution.C.\hspace{1em}Analogous structures are similar due to ancestry, but homologous structures are similar due to convergent evolution.D.\hspace{1em}Analogous structures always look similar but homologous structures do not.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because homologous structures are due to common ancestry, but analogous structures are not due to common ancestry and instead are the result of convergent evolution.Choice Bis incorrect because analogous structures are similar due to convergent evolution, where structures evolve independently but have similar functions due to the needs of the organisms.Choice Cis incorrect because analogous structures are not due to common ancestry.Choice Dis incorrect because homologous structures and analogous structures can sometimes look different.

list.title: Question 132
list.content:
The electric blue tarantula (Chilobrachys natanicharum, pictured below) is a newly-listed (2023) species found in the mangrove swamps of south-western Thailand. The vivid blue colour is created by nanostructures on the spider’s hairs that produce an iridescent effect.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2d9c8dd7-9273-4363-b0f3-46ca62fdff2e/images/3130ca0e-d70d-4ae6-9e0f-9a2d58bbfde3/BI2808.png)

The electric blue tarantulaChilobrachys natanicharum[Source: Chomphuphuang, Narinet al(2024 March, 28), File:Chilobrachys natanicharum2[image]. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved 2025 April, 30 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Chilobrachys_natanicharum2.jpg. CC BY 4.0]Which statement about the electric blue tarantula is most likely to be correct?A.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula would be able to mate successfully with another tarantula found in Thailand,Chilobrachys huahini, and produce fertile offspring.B.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula has recently evolved from darker-coloured species of tarantula.C.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula was previously classified in the class Insecta (insects).D.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula has existed for a long time, but was not discovered until recently.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because, like the vast majority of animal species that live on Earth today, this species had been unknown to humans. It has existed in remote areas away from human habitation, in a niche that makes it a rare global species. As such, it was not discovered until 2023, when human intervention to prevent habitat loss to palm oil farming identified the species.Choice Ais incorrect becauseChilobrachys huahiniis a distinct species; only members of the same species can reproduce successfully and produce fertile offspring.Choice Bis incorrect because there is no evidence of the recent emergence of this species; it is more likely to have been undiscovered for a long time.Choice Cis incorrect because all spiders, including the tarantula, belong to the classArachnida(arachnids). The key difference is the number of pairs of legs; insects have 3 pairs, whereas arachnids have 4 pairs.

list.title: Question 133
list.content: When constructing a dichotomous key for classifying bird species, which characteristic would be most appropriate for the first division in the key?A.\hspace{1em}Colour of feathersB.\hspace{1em}Habitat (forest, grassland, urban)C.\hspace{1em}Presence or absence of webbed feetD.\hspace{1em}Diet (carnivorous, herbivorous, omnivorous)
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because binary traits (presence/absence) work best for early divisions in a dichotomous key.Choice Ais incorrect because colour is too variable within a species.Choice Bis incorrect because habitat is a variable characteristic, so not suitable for classification.Choice Dis incorrect because diet varies within species and requires direct observation.

list.title: Question 134
list.content: Which of the following statement(s) is/are true for the genome?I.The genome is all the genetic information of an organism.II.Genomes within a species are identical in size.III.Genomes within a species vary in base sequence.A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme:
CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The genome is all the genetic information in an organism (Statement I). The base sequence can vary within a species due to single-nucleotide polymorphism (Statement III). Therefore,Choice Cis correct as it contains both true statements.Choice Ais incorrect as it only includes one true statement.
The size of the genome within a species can vary, this can be due to mutations, such as insertions and deletions, soStatement IIis not true.Choices BandDare, therefore, incorrect.

list.title: Question 135
list.content: What is the main cause of Southeast Asia's loss of dipterocarp forest ecosystems?A.\hspace{1em}Plantations of palm oil (Elaeis guineensis)B.\hspace{1em}Fungal disease affecting treesC.\hspace{1em}Nutrient depletion in the soilD.\hspace{1em}Anthropogenic climate change
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because palm oil plantations now cover large areas previously inhabited by dipterocarp species. Palm oil is used widely in the food and cosmetics industries.Choice Bis incorrect because, whilst fungal disease does occur in all natural rainforests, it has not caused widespread loss of dipterocarp species.Choice Cis incorrect because soil nutrient depletion will have occurred, but as a result of biodiversity loss, not a cause of it.Choice Dis incorrect because, whilst anthropogenic (human-caused) climate change is a cause of ecosystem loss, it is not the main cause in this case.

list.title: Question 137
list.content:
The image shows a water strider (G. lacustris) on the surface of a pond. What property of water is not depicted in the image?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/5f81029b-de8d-4958-a391-8fbc42cbbe3a/images/59e027ec-d597-4a15-a9f6-8f2f194143b9/BI1013.png)

[Source adapted from: Zinogre. (2021, July 11).File: Aquarius paludum 142592609.jpg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved July, 04 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Aquarius_paludum_142592609.jpg. Copyright free]A.\hspace{1em}AdhesionB.\hspace{1em}Exertion of buoyant forcesC.\hspace{1em}CohesionD.\hspace{1em}Thermal conductivity
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Thermal conductivity refers to a material's ability to conduct heat. While water does have a relatively high thermal conductivity compared to other liquids, this property is not directly related to the ability of the water strider to stay on the surface of the water. The image does not depict thermal conductivity, soChoice Dis correct.Choice Ais incorrect as adhesion is the ability of water to form hydrogen bonds with other polar molecules. The ability of the water strider to stay on the surface of the water is due to surface tension and adhesion between the water molecules and its legs.Choice Bis incorrect as the water strider can stay on the water surface due to the exertion of buoyant forces, which counteract its weight.Choice Cis incorrect as cohesion is the ability of water molecules to stick to each other, which creates the surface tension that allows the water strider to rest on top of the water.

list.title: Question 138
list.content: Why is it difficult for scientists to test hypotheses about the origin of the first cells?A.\hspace{1em}The conditions on pre-biotic Earth cannot be accurately replicatedB.\hspace{1em}The first cells are still alive, but are hard to studyC.\hspace{1em}Fossil evidence of protocells is abundant but hard to interpretD.\hspace{1em}Protocells did not contain nucleic acids
list.markScheme:
AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Scientists face significant challenges replicating the exact environmental conditions of early Earth because our understanding of its atmosphere, temperature, pressure, and chemical composition billions of years ago is limited;Choice Ais correct.The first cells appeared billions of years ago and are now extinct. Modern cells are descendants but not the original first cells;Choice Bis incorrect.
There is very limited or no direct fossil evidence of the first protocells because they were microscopic, soft-bodied, and lacked durable structures that fossilise well. The lack, rather than the abundance, of fossil evidence is a key challenge to testing the hypothesis about the origin of the first cells;Choice Cis incorrect.
Current scientific understanding strongly supports that protocells contained early forms of genetic material, such as RNA molecules. RNA is believed to have played a dual role as both a genetic material and a catalyst (ribozymes), making it central to hypotheses like the RNA world hypothesis.
Nucleic acids are crucial because they enable self-replication and heredity, essential for the evolution of life.Choice Dcontradicts the accepted hypotheses and is therefore incorrect.

list.markScheme: Anyfourof the following:→\ce{ -> }​surface area affects the rate at which materials enter and leave the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​volume affects the rate at which materials are used and produced by the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​the surface area to volume ratio affects the rate of metabolism in a cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​the bigger the cell, the smaller the SAratio is[1]→\ce{ -> }​cells having a low SAratio cannot exchange materials fast enough[1]→\ce{ -> }​some cells,ORmotor neurons,ORmuscle cells,ORother named example in humans, are long and thin, which maintains a high SAratio[1][4 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Thesurface areaof a cell affects the rate at which materialsenter and leave cells(✓\checkmark✓). On the other hand, the cell’svolumeaffects the rate at which materials areused and produced(✓\checkmark✓). A small surface area to volume ratio is not ideal for human cells because itlimits the cell’s ability to export waste from the cytoplasmrapidly enough to meet thecytoplasm’s metabolic needs, such as the availability of oxygen(✓\checkmark✓).A large cell has a small surface area to volume ratio(✓\checkmark✓). Therefore, the transport of the substances is more efficient in small cells.Anyfourof the following (function of life must be mentioned when explaining howParameciumperforms this, to award mark):→\ce{ -> }​functions of life are metabolismANDgrowthANDreproductionANDnutritionANDhomeostasisANDmovementANDexcretionANDresponse to stimuli,ORsensitivity[1]→\ce{ -> }​movement inParameciumis demonstrated by cilia used to propel themselves through water[1]→\ce{ -> }​response is through reacting to stimuli in the environmentORavoidance of light[1]→\ce{ -> }​homeostasis is demonstrated by keeping the internal conditions within set limitsORexcess water is expelled by the contractile vacuole[1]→\ce{ -> }​metabolism is carried out by enzymes in the cytoplasm[1]→\ce{ -> }​growth is an irreversible increase in sizeORdry mass and paramecium achieve this  through accumulating organic matterORnutrients from food[1]→\ce{ -> }​reproduction function inParameciumis demonstrated by asexual division through binary fission,ORmitosis or micronucleus and amitotic division of macronucleusORsexually through conjugation[1]→\ce{ -> }​excretion is the removal of metabolic waste products from the cellORdiffusion of CO2out of the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​nutrition is performed by ingesting smaller organisms and digesting them in vesiclesORthrough endocytosis[1][4 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Parameciumacquiresnutrientsby ingesting bacteria anddigesting them in vesicles(✓\checkmark✓). It exhibitsgrowthwhen itirreversibly increases in sizeby accumulating organic matter from ingestedfood(✓\checkmark✓).Parameciumrespondsto different environmental stimuli. For example, itchangesthedirectionof its movement once ittouchesa solid object (✓\checkmark✓).ExcretioninParameciumoccurs when waste products such ascarbon dioxide diffuse out of the cell(✓\checkmark✓).Parameciumreproducesboth asexually bybinary fission(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 142
list.content: Which statement highlights the importance of nucleosomes in DNA supercoiling ?A.\hspace{1em}To fit the length of DNA into the nucleusB.\hspace{1em}To access specific DNA sequencesC.\hspace{1em}To form a circular chromosomeD.\hspace{1em}To hold the information needed for coding amino acids
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A nucleosome helps to supercoil the DNA in order to package the DNA into a more condensed and compact structure. With this packaging, a length of DNA, totalling 2m, would be able to fit into the nucleus.Choice Ais correct.Even though the DNA is packed into the nucleus, nucleosomes can still allow access to specific DNA sequences for the transcription process (Choice B). DNA can be accessed with or without the nucleosomes present.The circular chromosome found in bacterial cells is shorter than the chromosomes of  eukaryotic cells so they do not require any DNA packaging, hence the absence of nucleosomes (Choice C).DNA acts as a template for RNA transcription, which then is used to code for amino acids. A nucleosome is used to supercoil the DNA and does not hold the information to code for amino acids (Choice D).

list.title: Question 144
list.content: Triticum monococcumis an einkorn wheat and was the first domesticated crop. It has a diploid number of 14 chromosomes.Triticum turgidumis a durum wheat with a total of 28 chromosomes. It is a result of the hybridization ofTriticum monococcumand another grassAegilops speltoideswhich also has a diploid number of 14. What is the correct term forTriticum turgidumin comparison toTriticum monococcum?A.\hspace{1em}HaploidB.\hspace{1em}TriploidC.\hspace{1em}HexaploidD.\hspace{1em}Tetraploid
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The normal diploid number (2n) means an organism has two sets of chromosomes, one from each parent.Triticum turgidumarose from a hybridisation event betweenTriticum monococcum(2n = 14) andAegilops speltoides(2n = 14). Following chromosome doubling, the resulting organism inherited two full sets of chromosomes from each parent, making it tetraploid (4n = 28).Choice Dis correct.Choice A(Haploid) is incorrect because haploid (n) refers to having one set of chromosomes, which would be 7 in this case.Choice B(Triploid) is incorrect because triploid (3n) means three sets, totalling 21 chromosomes.Choice C(Hexaploid) is incorrect because hexaploid (6n) refers to six sets, or 42 chromosomes.

list.title: Question 145
list.content: Which statements about unicellular and multicellular organisms are correct?Unicellular organismsMulticellular organismsA.\hspace{1em}They only reproduce asexuallyContains differentiated cellsB.\hspace{1em}Consist of only one cellAll cellular processes are carried out by one organelleC.\hspace{1em}Can reproduce sexuallyThey have emergent propertiesD.\hspace{1em}Contains differentiated cellsCan reproduce sexually
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais incorrect, as not all unicellular organisms reproduce asexually.Choice Bis incorrect, as both unicellular and multicellular organisms contain multiple organelles that carry out different functions.Choice Dis incorrect, because unicellular organisms do not contain more than one cell, and so do not contain multiple differentiated cells.

list.title: Question 146
list.content:
The diagram shows loose chromatin, also termed euchromatin. Which letter represents a histone protein?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d28246c4-7000-4425-b935-7d5de23ac5ed/images/ec5c08e2-e149-4c60-8ad8-1b991942b13f/BI1171i.png)

[© Revision Village 2023]
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:A histone is one of 8 proteins that DNA winds around so that it can be packaged efficiently into a cell’s nucleus.Choice Ais correct.Line B is pointing to the DNA wrapped around 8 histones;Choice Bis incorrect. Line C is pointing to a short section of DNA (linker DNA) that connects one nucleosome to the next;Choice Cis incorrect. Line D is pointing to a nucleosome, which is DNA wrapped around 8 histone proteins;Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 147
list.content: Which term to describe a property of water is matched to its correct definition?TermDefinitionA.\hspace{1em}Exerts buoyant forcesMuch energy is required to turn water into a vapourB.\hspace{1em}High specific heat capacityMuch energy is required to raise the temperature of 1kg water by 1 °CC.\hspace{1em}High boiling pointTurns from ice into steam at 100 °CD.\hspace{1em}Low viscosityEasily allows objects to float on the surface
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Water has a high specific heat capacity, meaning it can absorb or lose a lot of heat with only a small temperature change. This property helps maintain stable temperatures in organisms and aquatic environments.Choice Bis correct.Water exerts buoyant forces on objects, which means that it allows them to float easily on its surface. Objects that are less dense than the water they displace will experience an upward force greater than their weight, causing them to float.Choice Ais incorrect.A high boiling point means that liquid water turns into steam at 100°C;Choice Cis incorrect.Low viscosity means that water flows easily;Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 148
list.content: Which statement(s) below are challenges associated with the biological species concept (BSC)?I.The BSC assumes reproductive isolation, but some species are reproductively isolated only in certain environments.II.Fossil species cannot be assessed using the BSC due to the lack of observable mating behaviour.III.The BSC relies on morphological features, which can vary widely within a species.A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis true because reproductive isolation may be context-dependent (e.g. due to geography or behaviour), making it unclear whether two populations are separate species under BSC.Statement IIis true because the BSC depends on observing whether organisms can interbreed. This is impossible with fossils, which are studied based on morphology and location, not reproductive behaviour.Statement IIIis false because the BSC specifically does not define species based on morphology; that is the morphological species concept. BSC focuses instead on reproductive capability, so this is not a valid criticism of BSC.Choice Bis correct because it includes only the two trueStatements IandII.Choice Ais incorrect as it is missing the trueStatement II.Choices CandDare incorrect as they include the falseStatement III.

list.title: Question 149
list.content:
Shown in diagrams A and B are two pairs of similar structures.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/f8372de6-7083-44a4-b525-006eed25005b/images/3cd298f7-34ad-4f4c-bc2b-6b7a3b43bf2f/BI0857.png)

[© Revision Village 2022]Which of the following statements correctly explain the structural similarities shown in diagrams A and B?I.Structural similarities in diagram A are primarily due to random mutations, not common ancestry.II.Structural similarities in diagram B are due to the fact they both perform similar functions.III.Diagram A depicts analogous structures, and diagram B depicts homologous structures.A.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because onlystatement IIcorrectly explains the structural similarities.The bird and insect wings are similar due to convergent evolution.Statement IIIis incorrect because diagram A depicts homologous structures, and diagram B depicts analogous structures.Statement Iis incorrect because humans and bats evolved from a common ancestor, and random mutations slowly gave rise to differences in the pentadactyl limb between different species.Choices A, BandDare all incorrect because they include eitherstatements IorIII, or both.

list.title: Question 150
list.content:
The micrograph shows the ultrastructure of a cell. What type of cell is shown and what process is it undergoing?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/fea1bf52-eec5-4eec-b5ea-8f2d8a25bff5/images/418a09cc-3e55-4c17-b147-d0dfe66c6d9a/BI1471%20fig1.png)

[Source: Adapted from Lewis, M. E., Belland, R. J., AbdelRahman, Y. M., Beatty, W. L., Aiyar, A. A., Zea, A. H., Greene, S. J., Marrero, L., Buckner, L. R., Tate, D. J., McGowin, C. L., Kozlowski, P. A., O’Brien, M., Lillis, R. A., Martin, D. H., & Quayle, A. J. (2014, May 15). Morphologic and molecular evaluation of chlamydia trachomatis growth in human endocervix reveals distinct growth patterns. Frontiers. Retrieved February 11 , 2024, from https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fcimb.2014.00071/full. Copyright free]\hspace{1em}Type of cell\hspace{1em}\hspace{1em}Process\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}EukaryoticMitosisB.\hspace{1em}EukaryoticBinary fissionC.\hspace{1em}ProkaryoticMitosisD.\hspace{1em}ProkaryoticBinary fission
list.markScheme: DSample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Prokaryotic cells have an approximate diameter of 0.1−-−5.0  µm, whereas eukaryotic cells are significantly larger with a diameter range of 10−-−100  µm.  The cells in the micrograph have an approximate diameter of 0.5  µm, so are prokaryotic. Prokaryotic cells do not replicate themselves using mitosis, they use binary fission.Choice Dis correct.Choices AandBare incorrect as the cells in the micrograph are prokaryotic, not eukaryotic.Choice Cis incorrect as prokaryotic cells lack a mitotic spindle, so do not carry out mitosis, they carry out binary fission.

list.title: Question 151
list.content:
The diagram shows a human joint.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/05754fea-41d1-4915-aad1-882ade1c9e5b/images/47ad4795-c336-4258-9347-c1de2fb18e34/BI1408.png)

[© Revision Village 2024. Created with BioRender.com]Label the cartilage with the letter X.[1]State the name and role of the fluid found within this type of joint.[1]State one way in which skeletal muscle fibres are exceptions to the cell theory.[1]The contractile proteins actin and myosin in skeletal muscle fibres bring about movement of this joint. Explain how two other proteins within these cells, along with calcium, control the contraction of skeletal muscle.[3]
list.markScheme:
→\ce{ -> }​cartilage must be labelled with an X at the end of either bone[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/05754fea-41d1-4915-aad1-882ade1c9e5b/images/8846f3ce-713c-4b53-aedc-4aebff966c5e/BI1408AnsA.png)

[© Revision Village 2024. Created with BioRender.com]→\ce{ -> }​synovial fluidANDlubricates the jointsORprevents friction between bones[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The fluid within this type of joint is calledsynovial fluidand itlubricatesthe joint (✓\checkmark✓).Anyoneof the following:→\ce{ -> }​multinucleated[1]→\ce{ -> }​much largerORlonger than most cells[1]→\ce{ -> }​formed through fusion of multiple cells[1][1 mark maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:They aremultinucleated(✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​tropomyosin winds around actin, covering myosin-binding sitesORtropomyosin covers binding sites on actin[1]→\ce{ -> }​troponin bound to tropomyosin helps maintain position of tropomyosin on actin filament[1]→\ce{ -> }​action potentialORstimulation of muscle fibre by nerve impulse causes calcium ions to be released from sarcoplasmic reticulum[1]→\ce{ -> }​calcium ions bind to troponin, causing it to change shapeORbringing about conformational change[1]→\ce{ -> }​troponin bound to calcium ions moves tropomyosin away from myosin-binding sites allowing myosin to bind to actin[1]→\ce{ -> }​when no stimulation of muscle fibreORno action potential along sarcoplasm, calcium ions are actively pumped back into sarcoplasmic reticulum[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:The proteintropomyosinis coiled around actin filaments,coveringthemyosin-binding sites(✓\checkmark✓), and thereby preventing myosin forming cross bridges with the actin. Upon the arrival of anaction potential,calcium ionsarereleased fromthesarcoplasmic reticulum(✓\checkmark✓).  These calcium ions thenbindtotroponin, a proteinassociated withbothactin and tropomyosin, ((✓\checkmark✓). The binding of calcium ions totroponininduces aconformational change(✓\checkmark✓) in the protein, which in turn causestropomyosintoshift away frommyosin-binding sites. Consequently, themyosinheads are now free tobindtoactin(✓\checkmark✓), enabling muscle contraction to occur.

list.title: Question 152
list.content: The following table shows the diploid chromosome number of a range of species.OrganismDiploid chromosome numberYellow fever mosquito (Aedes egypti)6Fruit fly (Drosophila melanogaster)8Spinach (Spinacia oleracea)12Carrot (Daucus carota)18Rice (Oryza sativa)24Giraffe (Giraffa camelopardalis)30Giant panda (Ailuropoda melanoleuca)42Which of these statements is correct?A.\hspace{1em}The giant panda has more genes than the other speciesB.\hspace{1em}The yellow fever mosquito has the fewest genes from these speciesC.\hspace{1em}The gametes of carrots have 18 chromosomesD.\hspace{1em}The chromosome number is a characteristic of a species
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:All species have a characteristic number of chromosomes (Choice D).Gene number is not determined by chromosome number because chromosomes are not all the same size and do not hold the same number of genes (Choice AandChoice B).Choice Cis incorrect because gametes have a haploid number of chromosomes which means gametes of carrot plants have 9 chromosomes.
